Qingcheng, your father insisted. The bird's nest is from his supplier, the snow lotus is certified wild Tianshan, and the jewelry—well, you know his taste. It's his way of showing care.

GU QINGCHENG
(quietly)
Mom, Linfeng's family lives modestly. All this... won't it seem like I'm trying to buy their approval?

GU MOTHER
You're meeting his mother, not a business rival. Show respect. That's all.

GU QINGCHENG
(hesitating)
He said she values... substance over display.

GU MOTHER
Then she'll appreciate quality. Just be your genuine self.
(patting Qingcheng's hand)
I'll arrive after my meeting. Don't look so worried.

GU MOTHER stands, squeezes GU QINGCHENG's shoulder, and exits. GU QINGCHENG stares at the gifts, then carefully adds a small, worn recipe book to the pile before gathering everything.

Title: Heiress Meets Boyfriend's Parents
Description: A wealthy heiress brings expensive gifts to meet her boyfriend's mother for the first time, only to face unexpected humiliation.

INT. GU FAMILY LIVING ROOM - DAY

GU MOTHER arranges elegant gift boxes on the coffee table. GU QINGCHENG sits nearby, twisting her fingers.

GU MOTHER
Qingcheng, your father insisted. The bird's nest is from his supplier, the snow lotus is certified wild Tianshan, and the jewelry—well, you know his taste. It's his...
all_cases.continuation:
INT. CHEN FAMILY APARTMENT - HALLWAY - DAY

GU QINGCHENG stands before a modest wooden door, arms laden with gift boxes. She takes a deep breath, smooths her simple blouse, and knocks.

The door opens. CHEN MOTHER, mid-fifties, apron-clad, surveys the visitor with sharp eyes that linger on the designer packaging.

CHEN MOTHER
You must be Qingcheng.

GU QINGCHENG
(bowing slightly)
Auntie Chen. Thank you for having me.

CHEN MOTHER steps aside without warmth. GU QINGCHENG enters.

INT. CHEN FAMILY APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

A cramped but clean space. Plastic-covered furniture. Family photos crowd one wall. CHEN LINFENG rises from the sofa, relief flooding his face.

CHEN LINFENG
Qingcheng, you made it.
(moving to help with boxes)
Mom, I told you she was coming at—

CHEN MOTHER
(cutting him off)
I heard you the first three times.
(to Qingcheng)
Sit. Tea's ready.

GU QINGCHENG places the gifts on a small table. CHEN MOTHER's gaze hardens at the sight of the ornate boxes.

GU QINGCHENG
These are from my family. Bird's nest, some herbs, and—

CHEN MOTHER
(interrupting)
Bird's nest.
(pause)
How much did this cost? Ten thousand? Twenty?

GU QINGCHENG
I... my father selected them. He wanted to show respect—

CHEN MOTHER
Respect.
(laughs coldly)
Is that what they call it? Walking into someone's home with things worth more than our monthly rent?

CHEN LINFENG
Mom, please—

CHEN MOTHER
(to Linfeng)
You stay quiet.
(turning back to Qingcheng)
Tell me, Miss Gu. When you looked at our address, what did you think? That we needed charity?

GU QINGCHENG
(voice small)
That wasn't my intention, Auntie.

CHEN MOTHER picks up the bird's nest box, examines it with theatrical disdain.

CHEN MOTHER
My son works twelve-hour shifts. Comes home exhausted. And you—you probably spent more on this packaging than he earns in a week.

GU QINGCHENG
(internal monologue)
She's not wrong. Why didn't I listen to myself?

CHEN LINFENG
Mom, that's enough. You're being unfair.

CHEN MOTHER
Unfair?
(sets box down hard)
I'm protecting you. Girls like her don't marry boys like you. They play with them. Then they leave.

GU QINGCHENG's hands tremble. She reaches into the pile and pulls out the worn recipe book.

GU QINGCHENG
(quietly)
This... this was my grandmother's. She passed it to my mother, and my mother gave it to me.
(holding it out)
I brought it because Linfeng said you love cooking. I thought maybe... we could make something together someday.

CHEN MOTHER stares at the tattered book. Something flickers in her expression—curiosity, perhaps—before the hardness returns.

CHEN MOTHER
Pretty words.
(pushes the book back)
Keep your heirloom. I don't need your family's scraps any more than I need your expensive gifts.

GU QINGCHENG's eyes glisten. She sets the book down gently.

GU QINGCHENG
(standing)
I'm sorry for overstepping.
(to Linfeng)
I should go.

CHEN LINFENG
(grabbing her arm)
No. Stay. Mom, you haven't even given her a chance—

CHEN MOTHER
A chance to what? Convince me she's different?
(to Qingcheng)
You want to prove something, Miss Gu? Come back without the entourage of gifts. Come back dressed like a normal person, not like you're attending a charity gala. Then we'll talk.

GU QINGCHENG meets CHEN MOTHER's eyes. For a moment, neither speaks.

GU QINGCHENG
(steady now)
I will.

She turns and walks toward the door. CHEN LINFENG follows.

INT. CHEN FAMILY APARTMENT - HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS

CHEN LINFENG catches GU QINGCHENG's hand.

CHEN LINFENG
(whispering)
I'm so sorry. She's not usually—

GU QINGCHENG
(soft smile)
She loves you. That's all I saw in there.
(squeezing his hand)
I'll come back. Without the bird's nest.

She exits. CHEN LINFENG leans against the wall, exhaling.

INT. CHEN FAMILY APARTMENT - LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

CHEN MOTHER sits alone. She picks up the recipe book, opens it. Handwritten notes fill the margins—measurements adjusted, ingredients substituted, small drawings of flowers.

Her thumb brushes a faded inscription on the first page: "For my granddaughter. Cook with love, always."

CHEN MOTHER closes the book. Her jaw tightens.

CHEN MOTHER
(muttering)
Foolish girl.

But she doesn't put it down.

Title: Showdown, I Am the Group's Young Miss
Description: The heiress of a corporate empire goes undercover to investigate missing luxury goods and uncover corruption within a branch company.

EXT. REMOTE HIGHWAY - DAY

A refrigerated VAN with "XIA CORPORATION - LIQUID ASSETS" printed on the side drives along the highway. Three THUGS crouch in the bushes. The lead THUG BOSS wears a floral shirt.

THUG BOSS
Here it comes... here it comes...

His men throw a wooden board with nails onto the road. The van drives over it, TIRES BLOWING OUT. It brakes to an emergency stop.

THUG BOSS
Go!

The DRIVER gets out to check the tire. The THUGS, holding steel pipes, rush forward and surround the DRIVER. The THUG BOSS raises his steel pipe and smashes the car window with practiced precision.

INT. XIA CORPORATION CEO OFFICE - DAY

XIA MANTING studies a spreadsheet while XIA ZHIRONG examines a security photo of the wrecked van.

XIA MANTING
Third shipment this quarter. The insurance is bleeding us dry.

XIA ZHIRONG
(off photo)
That's not opportunistic theft. The security lock was dismantled with a key code. Someone on the inside gave them the route.

XIA MANTING
Father built that division himself. Every warehouse, every route.

XIA ZHIRONG
Let me embed. One week. I'll trace the inventory trails myself.

XIA MANTING
You'll be a ghost. No backup, no authority.

XIA ZHIRONG
Better. They'll think I'm just another desperate mid-level hire.

Title: Showdown, I Am the Group's Young Miss
Description: The heiress of a corporate empire goes undercover to investigate missing luxury goods and uncover corruption within a branch company.

EXT. REMOTE HIGHWAY - DAY

A refrigerated VAN with "XIA CORPORATION - LIQUID ASSETS" printed on the side drives along the highway. Three THUGS crouch in the bushes. The lead THUG BOSS wears a floral shirt.

THUG BOSS
Here it comes... here it comes...

His men throw a wooden board with nails onto the road. ...
all_cases.continuation:
XIA MANTING
(studying her)
You think desperation is your disguise? You're the face of this company. Every board member knows you.

XIA ZHIRONG
Not in the warehouse district. To them, I'm just another overeducated trust fund kid looking for a real job.

XIA MANTING
(realization dawning)
You're talking about starting from the bottom. Loading dock, inventory tracking...

XIA ZHIRONG
Security clearance level one. Access to the same systems the thieves are exploiting.

XIA MANTING
(standing, pacing)
One week. If you don't surface by Friday, I'm sending a recovery team.

XIA ZHIRONG
You'll blow my cover.

XIA MANTING
I'll save my sister's life.

Beat. Xia Zhirong nods reluctantly.

XIA ZHIRONG
One week. But I work alone.

XIA MANTING
(sitting back down)
You'll need credentials. New identity, background that checks out but doesn't connect back to us.

XIA ZHIRONG
I know people.

XIA MANTING
(concerned)
Zhirong... if this goes wrong, if they discover who you really are...

XIA ZHIRONG
They won't. I've been preparing for this my entire life.

She stands, straightens her blazer with quiet determination.

XIA ZHIRONG (CONT'D)
The shipment manifests - I want access to the original security protocols. If someone inside is selling route information, they'll have a pattern.

XIA MANTING
(pressing a button on her desk)
Jasmine. Pull the Q1-Q3 shipment security logs. Everything classified level three and above.

XIA ZHIRONG
I'm leaving tonight.

XIA MANTING
At least let me send a car—

XIA ZHIRONG
No cars. No connections to the main offices. I'll take public transit to the warehouse district.

XIA MANTING
(after a pause)
The Zhang warehouse. Third shift starts at midnight.

XIA ZHIRONG
(heading to door)
I'll be their new inventory coordinator by morning.

She pauses at the door, looking back.

XIA ZHIRONG (CONT'D)
Manting... if I find out it's someone high up in the company...

XIA MANTING
Then we'll handle it. Together.

Xia Zhirong nods and exits. Xia Manting stares at the security photo of the wrecked van, her jaw clenched with worry and determination.

FADE TO:

EXT. WAREHOUSE DISTRICT - NIGHT

Rows of industrial warehouses stretch into darkness. Xia Zhirong, now dressed in casual clothes and carrying a worn messenger bag, walks past loading docks. She checks her phone - a text message reads: "Zhang Warehouse, Dock 7. Ask for Manager Chen."

She approaches a security guard at a chain-link fence.

XIA ZHIRONG
Hi, I'm here about the inventory coordinator position.

SECURITY GUARD
(looking her up and down)
You the one Chen's expecting?

XIA ZHIRONG
Yes, sir.

He buzzes her through. She walks deeper into the maze of warehouses, the sound of forklifts and machinery echoing in the distance.

Title: Love Found Around the Corner
Description: A wealthy CEO finally gets his chance when the woman he has loved for three years breaks off her engagement and begins searching for a husband.

EXT. PARK PATH - DAY

A black Rolls-Royce stops by the roadside, the Spirit of Ecstasy hood ornament slowly rising. YE NANXI, in a suit and tie, gets out of the back seat, his ASSISTANT following behind.

ON SCREEN: YE NANXI, CEO OF SHENGSHI GROUP

ASSISTANT
She's been at the matchmaking event for an hour. Three rejections so far.

YE NANXI
Has she spoken to anyone?

ASSISTANT
Only to turn them down.

EXT. CIVIL AFFAIRS BUREAU MARRIAGE REGISTRATION OFFICE - DAY

A banner reads "ELITE SINGLES MATCHING EVENT." SU AN, wearing a white wedding dress, offers a card to a man on his phone.

ON SCREEN: SU AN, MISS OF THE SU FAMILY

SU AN
Su An. 25. Seeking marriage.

MAN ON PHONE
(impatiently)
With your scandal? Don't waste my time.

The man swats the card away. Papers flutter. SU AN's expression hardens—pride, not fragility.

EXT. PARK PATH - DAY

YE NANXI (V.O.)
Three years I've waited. Watched him destroy her piece by piece. Today, she stopped letting him.

ASSISTANT
Young Master, the board will say she's—

YE NANXI
(sternly)
She survived alone. What does that make us?

Title: Love Found Around the Corner
Description: A wealthy CEO finally gets his chance when the woman he has loved for three years breaks off her engagement and begins searching for a husband.

EXT. PARK PATH - DAY

A black Rolls-Royce stops by the roadside, the Spirit of Ecstasy hood ornament slowly rising. YE NANXI, in a suit and tie, gets out of the back seat, his ASSISTANT following behind.

ON SCREEN: YE NANXI, CEO OF SHENGSHI GROUP

ASSISTANT
She's been at the matchmaking event for an hour...
all_cases.continuation:
The ASSISTANT falls silent, chastened.

YE NANXI adjusts his cufflinks, eyes fixed on the distant white figure.

YE NANXI
(internal monologue)
Three years of board meetings. Three years of watching her smile fade in tabloid photos. Three years of my ring sitting in a drawer.

He begins walking toward the event.

ASSISTANT
Sir, your cover—

YE NANXI
(without turning)
Stay with the car.

EXT. CIVIL AFFAIRS BUREAU MARRIAGE REGISTRATION OFFICE - DAY

SU AN kneels to gather her scattered cards. Other attendees step around her, avoiding eye contact. She stacks them methodically, face unreadable.

A pair of polished Oxford shoes stops before her.

YE NANXI (O.S.)
You missed one.

A hand extends into frame, holding her card. SU AN looks up.

SU AN's POV: YE NANXI, backlit by afternoon sun, his expression carefully neutral.

SU AN
(standing, guarded)
Do I know you?

YE NANXI
We met once. The Jiang family's charity gala. You were wearing blue.

SU AN
(a flicker of surprise)
That was four years ago.

YE NANXI
(internal monologue)
Four years, two months, seventeen days. The night I stopped looking at anyone else.

YE NANXI
(aloud, simply)
Some things stay with you.

He takes a card from his pocket—plain white, black text. Hands it to her.

INSERT - THE CARD: "YE NANXI. 28. SEEKING MARRIAGE."

SU AN stares at it. Her composure cracks, just slightly.

SU AN
Shengshi Group's Ye Nanxi? At a matchmaking event?

YE NANXI
Is that disqualifying?

SU AN
(dry laugh)
It's suspicious.

YE NANXI
(meeting her eyes)
Then let me be direct. I'm not here for networking. I'm not here because my family sent me.

He pauses. The noise of the crowd seems to fade.

YE NANXI (CONT'D)
I'm here because you are.

He begins walking toward the event.

all_cases.context:
Title: Shallow Marriage, Deep Love
Description: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage endures her husband's cruelty while desperately hoping for his affection.

INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT

SONG WANQING sits alone on the sofa, clutching a medical bill from three years ago. The door opens. LU MING, dressed in a suit and visibly drunk, stumbles in.

SONG WANQING
(standing up, voice steady)
You're home.

LU MING
(eyes cold)
Song Wanqing, let's get divorced.

SONG WANQING
(smile freezing, forcing composure)
The probate hearing is next month. You agreed to five years.

SONG WANQING steps forward to help the swaying LU MING.

LU MING
(pushing her away)
Don't touch me!

SONG WANQING is pushed to the ground, the bill falling from her hand.

LU MING
(looking down at her, voice contemptuous)
Three years ago, while my father was dying, you and my grandmother conspired to chain me to this. What did you expect?

LU MING
I'll ask you one more time. Are we getting divorced or not?

SONG WANQING
(tears in her eyes, stubbornly)
No.

LU MING
(laughing bitterly in anger)
No?

LU MING suddenly leans down and grabs SONG WANQING by the throat.

LU MING
Then honor the contract you wrote.

SONG WANQING
(struggling)
Let me go!

LU MING
(moving closer, eyes vicious)
You bought five years, Song Wanqing. You've got two left.

SONG WANQING
(crying)
I won't divorce...

LU MING
Shut up. Your tears won't change the terms.

LU MING roughly pins SONG WANQING down on the sofa. The screen fades to black.

Description: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage endures her husband's cruelty while desperately hoping for his affection.

(standing up, voice steady)
You're home.

(eyes cold)
Song Wanqing, let's get divorced.

(smile free...
all_cases.continuation:
INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - BEDROOM - LATER

SONG WANQING lies motionless on the bed, staring at the ceiling. Moonlight cuts across her face, illuminating the red marks on her neck. LU MING's silhouette moves in the bathroom doorway.

LU MING
(buttoning his shirt, not looking at her)
The probate hearing. After that, we're done.

He exits. The bedroom door clicks shut.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
Two more years. I only need two more years.

She slowly sits up, wincing. Her hand moves to her abdomen, pressing gently.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
If he knew... would it change anything?

She reaches for her phone on the nightstand. The screen shows three missed calls from GRANDMOTHER LU.

INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - KITCHEN - MORNING

SONG WANQING stands at the stove, preparing breakfast. Dark circles under her eyes. A silk scarf covers her neck. The housekeeper, AUNT CHEN, watches her with concern.

AUNT CHEN
(quietly)
Madam, you don't have to—

SONG WANQING
(cutting her off, voice hollow)
He likes his eggs soft-boiled. Four minutes exactly.

AUNT CHEN
(hesitating)
Young Master already left. Before dawn.

SONG WANQING's hand freezes over the pot.

SONG WANQING
(forcing a smile)
Of course he did.

She turns off the stove. Stares at the untouched place setting.

INT. LU CORPORATION - CEO OFFICE - DAY

LU MING sits behind a massive desk, reviewing documents. His secretary, MISS ZHOU, enters.

MISS ZHOU
Sir, Miss Bai Luxi is here.

LU MING's expression softens almost imperceptibly.

LU MING
Send her in.

BAI LUXI, elegant and poised, enters carrying a paper bag.

BAI LUXI
(smiling warmly)
You missed breakfast again. I brought congee.

LU MING
(leaning back)
You didn't have to.

BAI LUXI
(setting the bag down)
Someone has to take care of you, Lu Ming.

She pauses, studying his face.

BAI LUXI
You look terrible. Was it her again?

LU MING
(jaw tightening)
Don't.

BAI LUXI
(sitting across from him)
The divorce papers are ready. My father's lawyers drew them up. She'd get nothing.

LU MING
It's not that simple. Grandmother's will—

BAI LUXI
(reaching for his hand)
Your grandmother is gone, Lu Ming. You're punishing yourself for a dead woman's wishes.

LU MING pulls his hand away. Stands. Walks to the window.

LU MING
(staring out)
She saved my father's life once. Did you know that?

BAI LUXI
(confused)
Who? Song Wanqing?

LU MING
(bitter laugh)
Her mother. A blood transfusion. That's why Grandmother arranged this whole thing.

BAI LUXI
(standing, moving to him)
A debt from the previous generation. That's what's keeping you trapped?

LU MING
(turning to face her)
I don't know what's keeping me anymore.

INT. CITY HOSPITAL - OBSTETRICS DEPARTMENT - DAY

SONG WANQING sits in a sterile waiting room, clutching a number ticket. Her phone buzzes. A text from GRANDMOTHER LU's old number—now managed by the family estate:

TEXT: "Monthly allowance deposited. Remember your promise."

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
A promise to a ghost. That's all I have left.

NURSE (O.S.)
Song Wanqing?

SONG WANQING looks up, startled.

INT. EXAMINATION ROOM - CONTINUOUS

A DOCTOR reviews an ultrasound image. SONG WANQING sits rigidly on the examination table.

DOCTOR
(professional, gentle)
Eight weeks. The fetus is healthy, but your blood pressure is concerning. Have you been under stress?

SONG WANQING
(hollow laugh)
You could say that.

DOCTOR
Mrs. Lu, I have to be direct. Your body shows signs of repeated physical trauma. If you're in an unsafe situation—

SONG WANQING
(standing abruptly)
I'm fine. Thank you, Doctor.

She takes the ultrasound printout. Stares at the small, bean-shaped form.

SONG WANQING
(whispering)
What am I going to do with you?

INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - STUDY - NIGHT

SONG WANQING sits at an antique desk, the ultrasound hidden in a book. She opens a drawer, revealing a stack of letters addressed to LU MING—all unopened, all returned.

She picks up a pen. Begins writing.

SONG WANQING (V.O.)
"Lu Ming, I know you won't read this. You never do. But I need to tell someone, even if that someone will never listen..."

The front door slams. SONG WANQING quickly hides the letter.

LU MING (O.S.)
(shouting)
Song Wanqing!

She closes her eyes. Steadies her breath. Rises.

INT. LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

LU MING stands in the center of the room, holding a manila envelope. His face is thunderous.

LU MING
What the hell is this?

He throws the envelope at her feet. Medical records spill out—her hospital visits, her prescriptions.

LU MING
You've been going to the hospital every week. What are you hiding?

SONG WANQING
(kneeling to gather the papers)
It's nothing. Just routine checkups.

LU MING
(grabbing her arm, yanking her up)
Don't lie to me. Are you sick? Is this some ploy for sympathy?

SONG WANQING
(meeting his eyes)
Would you care if I was?

LU MING falters. For a moment, something flickers in his expression—doubt, perhaps even concern. Then it hardens.

LU MING
I care about what affects the inheritance. That's all.

He releases her. Turns away.

LU MING
Whatever it is, handle it quietly. I won't have scandals before the hearing.

He walks toward the stairs. Stops.

LU MING
(without turning)
Luxi is coming for dinner tomorrow. Make yourself scarce.

SONG WANQING
(quietly)
In my own home?

LU MING
(finally turning, voice like ice)
Your home? You're a tenant, Song Wanqing. Nothing more.

He disappears upstairs.

SONG WANQING stands alone, one hand unconsciously moving to her stomach.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
A tenant. A contract. A child he'll never want.

She picks up the scattered medical records. One ultrasound image remains on the floor. She stares at it.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
But you're mine. The only thing in this house that's truly mine.

She presses the image to her chest.

FADE OUT.

INT. UPSCALE RESTAURANT - PRIVATE ROOM - NIGHT

LU MING and BAI LUXI sit across from each other, wine glasses half-empty. Soft jazz plays in the background.

BAI LUXI
(swirling her wine)
You're distracted tonight.

LU MING
(rubbing his temples)
It's nothing.

BAI LUXI
(leaning forward)
It's her, isn't it? What did she do now?

LU MING
(long pause)
She's been hiding something. Hospital visits. I had my secretary pull her records.

BAI LUXI
(frowning)
And?

LU MING
They were incomplete. Someone redacted the details.

BAI LUXI
(suspicious)
She has connections at the hospital?

LU MING
(shaking his head)
Her mother was a nurse there. Before she died.

BAI LUXI
(reaching across the table)
Lu Ming, listen to me. Whatever game she's playing, don't fall for it. Women like her—they're manipulators.

LU MING
(pulling back)
You don't know her.

BAI LUXI
(surprised)
Are you defending her?

LU MING
(standing abruptly)
I need some air.

He exits. BAI LUXI watches him go, her expression calculating.

BAI LUXI
(to herself)
What are you hiding, Song Wanqing?

She pulls out her phone. Dials.

BAI LUXI
(into phone)
It's me. I need you to dig deeper. The hospital records. Find out what she's really up to.

EXT. RESTAURANT BALCONY - CONTINUOUS

LU MING leans against the railing, staring at the city lights. He pulls out his phone. Scrolls to SONG WANQING's contact. His thumb hovers over the call button.

FLASHBACK - INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - THREE YEARS AGO - DAY

A younger LU MING sits beside his dying father, LU ZHENGTING. GRANDMOTHER LU stands at the foot of the bed, frail but commanding.

GRANDMOTHER LU
(to Lu Ming)
The Song girl. Her mother gave your father blood when no one else matched. We owe them everything.

LU MING
(exhausted)
Grandmother, I can't—

LU ZHENGTING
(weakly, grabbing Lu Ming's hand)
Son... promise me. Take care of her.

LU MING
(voice breaking)
Father...

LU ZHENGTING's monitors flatline. Nurses rush in.

GRANDMOTHER LU
(gripping Lu Ming's shoulder)
You will marry her. It's already arranged.

END FLASHBACK

EXT. RESTAURANT BALCONY - PRESENT - CONTINUOUS

LU MING closes his eyes. His grip tightens on the phone.

LU MING
(to himself)
A promise to the dead.

He puts the phone away without calling.

INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - SONG WANQING'S ROOM - SAME TIME

SONG WANQING lies in bed, unable to sleep. She holds the ultrasound image up to the dim light.

SONG WANQING
(whispering)
Your father doesn't know you exist. Maybe that's for the best.

Her phone lights up. A text from an unknown number:

TEXT: "I know your secret. Meet me tomorrow. Riverside Park. 3 PM. Come alone."

SONG WANQING sits up, heart pounding.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
Who else knows?

She clutches the phone, fear and determination warring on her face.

FADE TO BLACK.

INT. LU FAMILY VILLA - BEDROOM - LATER

SONG WANQING lies motionless on the bed, staring at the ceiling. Moonlight cuts across her face, illuminating the red marks on her neck. LU MING's silhouette moves in the bathroom doorway.

LU MING
(buttoning his shirt, not looking at her)
The probate hearing. After that, we're done.

He exits. The bedroom door clicks shut.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
Two more years. I only need two more years.

She slowly sits up, wincing. Her hand moves to her abdomen, pressing gently.

SONG WANQING
(internal monologue)
If he knew... would it change anything?

She reaches for her phone on the nightstand. The screen shows three missed calls from GRANDMOTHER LU.

Title: Uncle's Little Wife
Description: A young woman deliberately sabotages her arranged marriage meeting with an old man by appearing in outrageous attire, but her plan backfires when he approves of the match anyway.

INT. LAKESIDE PAVILION - DAY

OLD GU sits holding a cane inlaid with rubies.

CHAIRMAN TANG sits across from OLD GU. Exquisite dishes are laid out on the table.

Several BODYGUARDS in black suits approach carrying expensive gift boxes.

CHAIRMAN TANG
Old Gu, I trust Nuannuan's portrait meets your standards?

OLD GU looks at a photo of a girl. The girl in the photo is demure and poised.

OLD GU
Acceptable. She knows her angles.

CHAIRMAN TANG
(relieved)
She's been groomed for this alliance since childhood.

Suddenly, TANG NUANNUAN appears in the doorway. She sports a neon-pink wig, a clashing floral jacket, and holds a comically oversized lollipop. She swaggers toward them.

CHAIRMAN TANG
(horrified)
Miss, you've mistaken this pavilion for the costume party.

TANG NUANNUAN
(defiantly)
Cut the act, Dad. I'm your three o'clock.

OLD GU
(intrigued)
Remarkable. You share minimal DNA with this photograph.

TANG NUANNUAN
That's Photoshop for you. The photo's my highlight reel.

TANG NUANNUAN grabs a shrimp dumpling. CHAIRMAN TANG looks mortified. OLD GU appears calculating.

(gestures to her outfit with his cane)
—has bite.

TANG NUANNUAN
(stuffing the dumpling in her mouth)
Glad you noticed. I bite back harder than your accountants do during merger talks.

CHAIRMAN TANG
Nuannuan! Apologize this instant!

TANG NUANNUAN
(ignoring him, eyes locked on OLD GU)
You wanted a porcelain doll? Too bad. You got a wildfire in stilettos.

OLD GU
(chuckles dryly)
Porcelain shatters. Wildfires... reshape landscapes.

He taps his cane once—sharp, deliberate. The bodyguards freeze mid-step.

OLD GU (CONT'D)
Cancel the betrothal banquet.

CHAIRMAN TANG
(relieved but confused)
Of course, Old Gu. My deepest apologies—

OLD GU
(interrupting)
Cancel it so we can plan a wedding instead.

TANG NUANNUAN
(spitting out her lollipop stick)
What?!

OLD GU
(smiling thinly)
I don’t marry ornaments. I marry forces of nature. And you, Miss Tang… are a Category Five storm in a sequin jacket.

CHAIRMAN TANG
(stammering)
But—but the contract stipulates—

OLD GU
The contract stipulates compatibility. And nothing says compatible like chaos that answers to no one but me.

TANG NUANNUAN
(backing away slowly)
Hold on. I didn’t sabotage this meeting to get *hired* as your wife—I did it to get *fired* from the whole damn arrangement!

OLD GU
Too late. You auditioned. You got the part.

He snaps his fingers. A bodyguard steps forward and offers TANG NUANNUAN a small jade box.

OLD GU (CONT'D)
Engagement gift. Don’t lose it. Or do. I’d enjoy watching you retrieve it from the bottom of the lake.

TANG NUANNUAN stares at the box, then at her father’s ashen face, then back at OLD GU—his eyes glinting like the rubies in his cane.

TANG NUANNUAN
(internal monologue)
Oh, you ancient dragon... you just turned my escape plan into a cage with better lighting.

She snatches the box.

TANG NUANNUAN (CONT'D)
Fine. But I wear what I want. Say what I want. And if you ever call me “porcelain” again, I’ll melt your ruby cane into a paperweight.

OLD GU
(grinning)
Noted, little wife.

FADE OUT.

Title: CEO Fu's Mysterious Wife & The Runaway Wife is Beautiful and Cool
Description: A woman married for three years to a CEO she's never met has a wild night with a stranger at a bar, only to discover he might be closer than she thinks.

INT. BAR - NIGHT

A hand lifts a fox mask from the wall. RUOHAN (26), face obscured, scans the room. Her gaze lands on CEO FU (32), solitary in a VIP booth with a half-empty glass. She glides over, perches beside him, fingers trailing his thigh.

RUOHAN
(muffled behind mask)
Handsome. Can I borrow your... belt?

CEO FU
(eyes darkening)
Is that a request or a confession?

RUOHAN
Which one makes you unzip it?

CEO FU
(captures her wrist)
The one that gets you into trouble.

RUOHAN
Then I'm already there.

CEO FU
(sweeps her into his arms)
Let's see how deep.

INT. HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT

CEO FU lays RUOHAN on the bed. Silk sheets catch the moonlight. The fox mask stays on as his tie slides free. Their shadows merge on the wall.

INT. HOTEL ROOM - DAY

Morning light stripes across couture casualties. RUOHAN's eyes snap open—CEO FU asleep beside her, his hand resting on her hip. She freezes. Recognition slams into her: she's memorized this face in Forbes. Her gaze drops to the lingerie strap on her shoulder. Panic crystallizes.

all_cases.continuation:
RUOHAN
(internal monologue)
Fu Heng. My husband. The man who thinks I’m a boring vase collecting dust in his mansion.

She holds her breath, inching away from his touch. Every rustle of the silk sheets sounds like a gunshot. CEO FU shifts, his arm tightening reflexively around the empty space where she just was.

Ruohan freezes, one foot on the floor. He doesn't wake.

She moves with the speed of a desperate woman. Dress. Heels. Purse. She snatches the fox mask from the nightstand, intending to hide the evidence, but stops. A reckless idea sparks in her eyes.

She opens her wallet. Takes out a stack of crisp bills. She slams them down on the nightstand next to his head.

RUOHAN
(whispering)
Thanks for the service. Five stars.

She turns and bolts, the door clicking shut behind her.

The room falls silent.

Slowly, CEO FU opens his eyes. They are clear, alert, and dangerous. He sits up, the sheet pooling at his waist, and looks at the money.

He picks up the bills, a dark smirk curving his lips.

CEO FU
(low voice)
You think you can run after eating your fill?

He spots something glittering on the carpet—a single diamond earring. He picks it up, rolling the cold stone between his thumb and forefinger.

CEO FU
Find her.

INT. FU MANSION - LIVING ROOM - LATER

Ruohan bursts through the front door, hair disheveled, clutching her shoes. She leans against the heavy oak door, gasping for air.

MAID LI (50s) walks in, holding a feather duster. She stops, eyeing Ruohan’s state.

MAID LI
Madam? You didn't come home last night. The Old Master called.

Ruohan straightens up, smoothing her dress, instantly composing her face into a mask of indifference.

RUOHAN
I was... at a spa retreat. Very intense deep tissue massage.

MAID LI
(skeptical)
With your dress inside out?

Ruohan looks down. Curses under her breath.

MAID LI
The Old Master insists on a family dinner tonight. He says Mr. Fu will be attending.

Ruohan’s blood runs cold.

RUOHAN
He... he's coming?

MAID LI
Yes. He just landed from a business trip. Or so his assistant says.

Ruohan touches her ear, realizing the earring is missing. The memory of the hotel room—the money, the insult—crashes over her.

RUOHAN
(to herself)
I treated the CEO of the Fu Group like a gigolo. And tonight I have to pass him the salt.

She sinks onto the expensive sofa, staring blankly at the ceiling.

RUOHAN
If I play dead, do you think they'll cancel dinner?

Title: The Mu Manor's Daughter's Wedding
Description: A noble family's daughter marries and leaves home to travel to the capital, bidding farewell to her beloved family.

INT. MU ROYAL MANOR - DAY

The plaque of the Mu Royal Manor hangs high, the atmosphere solemn yet tinged with the sadness of parting.

MU CHANGXUAN wears a magnificent red wedding dress, a phoenix crown on her head, her features exquisite, but her eyes filled with reluctance to leave her family.

MU CHANGXUAN'S FATHER holds his daughter's hand, pressing the sword callus on her palm.

MU CHANGXUAN'S FATHER
Shengjing is not our Northwest. Shen Yan is a good man, but your temper is a blade. Sheathe it wisely.

MU CHANGXUAN (eyes brimming with tears)
Father, who will remind me to wear my cloak?

MU CHANGXUAN'S MOTHER adjusts the phoenix crown.

MU CHANGXUAN'S MOTHER
Your father checked the dowry list seven times. Write to us. Not just the good parts.

MU CHANGXUAN
Father, Mother, Brothers... Xuan'er is leaving. You must all take care.

MU JING, Mu Changxuan's eldest brother, has a serious expression.

MU JING
Imperial decree binds us to the Northwest. Not even for your wedding. Do not forgive us.

SECOND BROTHER offers a small falcon bell.

SECOND BROTHER
The capital speaks in whispers. Ring this at the northern gate.

THIRD BROTHER cracks his knuckles.

THIRD BROTHER
If Shen Yan forgets that elbow strike—remind him.

MU CHANGXUAN, hearing this, smiles through her tears.

MU CHANGXUAN'S FATHER holds his...
all_cases.continuation:
MU CHANGXUAN wipes her tears, a soft smile lingering on her lips.

MU CHANGXUAN
I have the best family in all the land. How could I ever forget?

She steps forward, embracing each of her brothers in turn, then her parents. The embrace is tight, full of unspoken words.

MU CHANGXUAN'S FATHER (voice thick)
Remember your roots, Xuan'er.

MU CHANGXUAN
Always.

A SERVANT appears at the doorway, bowing.

SERVANT
My lady, the carriage is ready.

MU CHANGXUAN nods, releasing her family. She takes a deep breath, straightens her posture, and turns to follow the servant.

MU CHANGXUAN
Goodbye.

She walks out of the room, the sound of her footsteps echoing in the hall. The family remains, watching the empty doorway.

MU JING
She will make us proud.

SECOND BROTHER
She already has.

FADE OUT.

Title: I Return to the 90s to Open a Hotpot Restaurant
Description: A time-traveler buys a warm coat for his mother in 1990s, but gossip reveals a darker truth about his family loyalties.

INT. CLOTHING STORE - DAY

TIANHE walks into a bustling 1990s clothing store, glancing at the calendar: "1995."

TIANHE
Brother Zhang.

BROTHER ZHANG looks up from his newspaper.

BROTHER ZHANG
Tianhe! How's the hotpot restaurant?

TIANHE
Almost ready. Which coat is warmest?

BROTHER ZHANG
For your mother? These just came in.

Brother Zhang pulls out a black leather jacket and a red fleece coat. Tianhe's fingers trace the red fleece gently.

TIANHE
This one. Price?

BROTHER ZHANG
Thirty. Pure wool.

TIANHE
Perfect.

Tianhe pays, hugging the coat. He pulls out a notebook—"1995 Business Plan" visible.

TIANHE (V.O.)
Last timeline, Mom froze in rags. Not this time.

BROTHER ZHANG
Gift wrap?

TIANHE
She'll wear it home. Thanks.

Tianhe exits. Two customers approach the counter.

CUSTOMER 1
Always buying for his mother. Such a good son.

BROTHER ZHANG
(quietly, watching through window)
Last week his "mother" got a TV. My sister lives next door—she says his real mother wears newspapers in her shoes.

CUSTOMER 2
Maybe she needs it more?

BROTHER ZHANG
(shakes head)
The other mother. His real one hasn't seen him in a month.

CUSTOMER 1
(scoffing)
Another fool marrying the mistress and forgetting his own.

INT. CLOTHING STORE - CONTINUOUS

Brother Zhang folds the newspaper, shaking his head as he watches Tianhe walk away with the red coat.

BROTHER ZHANG
(to the customers)
His real mother's been sick for months. Neighbor says she can't afford medicine, but here he is buying luxury coats for... well, you know.

CUSTOMER 1
(muttering)
Some men have no shame.

CUSTOMER 2
At least he's providing for someone.

Brother Zhang picks up his scissors, snipping thread from another garment.

BROTHER ZHANG
Providing? His mistress lives in that new apartment complex. Marble floors, imported furniture. Meanwhile, his mother shares a room with three other families in the old compound.

A beat of silence.

CUSTOMER 1
What about his father?

BROTHER ZHANG
(bitter laugh)
Dead for three years. Left him the restaurant property and all the savings. Should have gone to his mother—widow's pension isn't enough to live on.

Brother Zhang looks out the window again, where Tianhe's figure is growing smaller in the distance.

BROTHER ZHANG (CONT'D)
But what does a good son do? Buys his mistress a thirty-yuan wool coat while his real mother counts pennies for rice.

CUSTOMER 2
(sighing)
Some people never change, even with money.

Brother Zhang returns to his newspaper, but his eyes drift back to the window.

BROTHER ZHANG
(quietly)
In my day, we knew who our real family was.

The bell above the door CHIMES as another customer enters. Brother Zhang puts on his professional smile, but the weight of what he's just shared lingers in the air.

FADE OUT.

all_cases.context:
Title: Rise to the Peak After Devaluation
Description: A man killed by a rich driver is reborn into a world where global currency has devalued by a million times, making his small savings worth a fortune.

ON SCREEN: DEVALUATION - RISE TO THE PEAK

EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY

A black Mercedes speeds in, stopping with a sharp drift. The EX-GIRLFRIEND, dressed in luxury, emerges and slaps ZHOU SHENG.

EX-GIRLFRIEND
You think I'd have cheated if you weren't broke?

ZHOU SHENG
Lanlan, just listen—

The RICH SECOND GEN sneers from inside the car.

The EX-GIRLFRIEND shoves ZHOU SHENG onto the hood. The RICH SECOND GEN laughs, watching.

EXT. ROADSIDE - DAY

ZHOU SHENG walks on, shattered. His MOTHER chases after him, clutching a handmade sweater.

MOTHER
Son... please. Mom made this for you. Winter's coming.

A red sports car screams toward them.

MOTHER
(screaming)
Ah!

ZHOU SHENG and MOTHER collapse in a pool of blood. The DRIVER and FEMALE COMPANION step out, shaken.

FEMALE COMPANION
(terrified)
He's... he's dead.

DRIVER
(coldly)
Dead poor people don't sue. It's cheaper than injuries. Let's go.

They drive away.

MOTHER
(weakly)
Save my son...

ZHOU SHENG lies there, eyes burning with rage and regret.
all_cases.context_excerpt:

Description: A man killed by a rich driver is reborn into a world where global currency has devalued by a million times, making his small savings worth a fortune.

ON SCREEN: DEVALUATION - RISE TO THE PEAK

EXT. HIGHWAY - DAY

A black Mercedes speeds in, stopping with a sharp drift. The EX-GIRLFRIEND, dressed in luxury, emerges and slaps ZHOU SHENG.

EX-GIRLFRIEND
You think I'd have cheated if you weren't broke?

ZHOU SHENG
Lanlan, just listen—

The RICH...
all_cases.continuation:
FADE TO BLACK.

SUPER: "Three days later"

FADE IN:

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY

Sterile white walls. Monitors beep steadily. ZHOU SHENG lies in bed, eyes closed. His fingers twitch.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Am I... alive?

His eyes snap open. He gasps, sitting up violently. The IV nearly rips from his arm.

NURSE rushes in, mid-twenties, startled.

NURSE
Sir! You're awake! Please, stay calm—

ZHOU SHENG
My mother—where's my mother?!

The NURSE hesitates. Her expression says everything.

ZHOU SHENG
(breaking)
No... no, no, no—

He tries to stand. His legs buckle. The NURSE catches him.

NURSE
I'm so sorry. She... she didn't make it.

ZHOU SHENG collapses back onto the bed, face contorted in grief.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Mom... I couldn't protect you. I couldn't protect anyone.

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - LATER

ZHOU SHENG stares at the ceiling, hollow. A DOCTOR enters with a clipboard.

DOCTOR
Mr. Zhou, you're lucky to be alive. Three days in a coma. We need to discuss your bill.

ZHOU SHENG
(bitter laugh)
Bill. Of course.

DOCTOR
The total comes to... let me see... 8.7 billion yuan.

ZHOU SHENG sits up slowly, certain he misheard.

ZHOU SHENG
Eight point seven... billion?

DOCTOR
(matter-of-fact)
Yes. That's standard for three days of intensive care. Will you be paying by card or transfer?

ZHOU SHENG
(stunned)
What kind of hospital charges billions for—

His phone buzzes on the nightstand. He grabs it, hands trembling.

INSERT - PHONE SCREEN

A news notification: "GLOBAL CURRENCY DEVALUATION ENTERS THIRD DAY - ALL CURRENCIES NOW WORTH 1/1,000,000 OF PREVIOUS VALUE"

BACK TO SCENE

ZHOU SHENG's jaw drops.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
One millionth... that means...

He opens his banking app with shaking fingers.

INSERT - PHONE SCREEN

Account Balance: ¥87,000,000,000,000
(Eighty-seven trillion yuan)

BACK TO SCENE

ZHOU SHENG
(whisper)
Eighty-seven... trillion?

DOCTOR
Sir? Your payment?

ZHOU SHENG stares at the screen, then at the DOCTOR, then back at the screen.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
I had 87 million saved. Every penny I scraped together for years. Lanlan called me broke... but now...

He laughs. Softly at first, then louder. The DOCTOR steps back, concerned.

DOCTOR
Mr. Zhou, are you feeling alright?

ZHOU SHENG
(wiping tears)
I'm feeling... better than I have in years.

He transfers the payment. The DOCTOR's tablet pings.

DOCTOR
(eyes widening)
Thank you, sir. Is there... anything else you need?

ZHOU SHENG swings his legs off the bed. His eyes harden.

ZHOU SHENG
Yes. I need the name of the driver who hit us.

DOCTOR
The police report should have—

ZHOU SHENG
(cold)
Get it for me.

The DOCTOR hurries out. ZHOU SHENG stands at the window, looking out at the city skyline.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Mom... I'll make them pay. Every single one of them. The driver. Lanlan. That rich bastard she left me for. In this new world... I have the power to destroy them all.

He clenches his fist.

ZHOU SHENG
(quietly)
And I will.

EXT. HOSPITAL ENTRANCE - DAY

ZHOU SHENG walks out, still in hospital clothes. People rush past, panicked. ATMs have lines stretching around blocks. Store signs display astronomical prices.

A STREET VENDOR hawks bottled water.

STREET VENDOR
Water! Fresh water! Only 500 million per bottle!

ZHOU SHENG watches the chaos, unmoved.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
The whole world is falling apart. But for me... this is just the beginning.

His phone buzzes. Unknown number.

ZHOU SHENG
Hello?

DETECTIVE WANG (V.O.)
(through phone)
Mr. Zhou Sheng? This is Detective Wang. We've identified the driver who struck you and your mother.

ZHOU SHENG
(gripping phone tighter)
Who?

DETECTIVE WANG (V.O.)
His name is Chen Haoyu. Son of Chen Enterprises. I should warn you—his family is extremely powerful. They've already offered a settlement.

ZHOU SHENG
(ice cold)
How much?

DETECTIVE WANG (V.O.)
Ten trillion yuan.

A long pause.

ZHOU SHENG
Tell them... I decline.

DETECTIVE WANG (V.O.)
Sir, I really think you should consider—

ZHOU SHENG
I said no. I want to meet Chen Haoyu. Face to face.

He hangs up.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Ten trillion for my mother's life. They think money can buy their way out of murder. They're about to learn... I have more money than God. And I have nothing left to lose.

He hails a passing taxi.

ZHOU SHENG
Take me to the most expensive tailor in the city.

TAXI DRIVER
(whistling)
That'll cost you a few billion, friend.

ZHOU SHENG
(getting in)
I can afford it.

The taxi pulls away into the chaotic streets.

FADE OUT.
all_cases.continuation_excerpt:
FADE TO BLACK.

SUPER: "Three days later"

FADE IN:

INT. HOSPITAL ROOM - DAY

Sterile white walls. Monitors beep steadily. ZHOU SHENG lies in bed, eyes closed. His fingers twitch.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Am I... alive?

His eyes snap open. He gasps, sitting up violently. The IV nearly rips from his arm.

NURSE rushes in, mid-twenties, startled.

NURSE
Sir! You're awake! Please, stay calm—

ZHOU SHENG
My mother—where's my mother?!

The NURSE hesitates. Her expression says everything.

ZHOU SHENG
(breaking)
No... no, no, no—

He tries to stand. His legs buckle. The NURSE catches him.

NURSE
I'm so sorry. She... she didn't make it.

ZHOU SHENG collapses back onto the bed, face contorted in grief.

ZHOU SHENG (V.O.)
(internal monologue)
Mom... I couldn't protect you. I couldn'...

all_cases.context:
Title: Eight Years Later
Description: A woman secretly posing as the righteous thief Jade Hero to aid the poor discovers her husband, comatose for eight years, has finally awakened.

INT. OUTSIDE GOVERNMENT OFFICE - DAY

An OFFICIAL rides his horse, shouting angrily.

OFFICIAL
Sealed! Every road out of the province!
I want Jade Hero's head by dawn!

A masked figure, JADE HERO, leaps across rooftops above a bamboo forest. The OFFICIAL's guards rampage through an impoverished village, and VILLAGERS scatter to avoid them.

VILLAGER (V.O.)
(whispered)
Bless you, Jade Hero...

INT. DILAPIDATED SHACK - DAY

A LITTLE GIRL sits by the bed, caring for her seriously ill MOTHER.

LITTLE GIRL
(quietly desperate)
I'll find a way. The apothecary said three days—

MOTHER
(weakly)
No, child. Let me go.

A cloth pouch lands in the doorway. The LITTLE GIRL retrieves it, revealing silver taels.

LITTLE GIRL
(breathless)
Mother... it's from Jade Hero.

MOTHER
(tearfully)
Then I can die in peace... May heaven guard that noble soul.

Title: Eight Years Later
Description: A woman secretly posing as the righteous thief Jade Hero to aid the poor discovers her husband, comatose for eight years, has finally awakened.

all_cases.continuation:
INT. DILAPIDATED SHACK - DAY

The LITTLE GIRL clutches the pouch, tears spilling over her cheeks. She presses it into her MOTHER'S hand, then darts toward the door.

LITTLE GIRL
I'll go to the apothecary. I'll bring the medicine back.

MOTHER
(child's name)...

But the LITTLE GIRL is already gone, small feet pounding across the packed earth.

EXT. VILLAGE STREET - DAY

The LITTLE GIRL weaves through stalls, dodging the heavy boots of OFFICIAL'S GUARDS. She skids to a halt before an apothecary sign. Breathless, she holds out a silver tael.

LITTLE GIRL
Please. For my mother. The fever...

The APOTHECARY weighs the silver, then hands her a small bundle of herbs.

APOTHECARY
Brew it strong. Three times a day.

She nods, hugging the herbs to her chest.

EXT. HUMBLE COURTYARD - DAY

A modest courtyard. Laundry flutters on a line. A wooden bucket sits by a stone well.

JADE HERO (WOMAN), still masked, drops from the wall. She removes her mask, revealing a weathered but determined face. She is LIN YUE, the woman behind the legend. She hides her mask beneath a loose tile.

She moves toward the inner door, her movements quiet but tired.

INT. HUMBLE BEDROOM - DAY

Dust motes dance in a shaft of sunlight. A simple bed. On it lies HUSBAND (SHEN WEI), pale but stirring. His eyes flutter open, unfocused at first.

HUSBAND
...water...

Lin Yue freezes. She stares, heart hammering. Then she rushes to the bedside, lifting a cup to his lips.

LIN YUE
(whispered)
I'm here. I'm here.

He drinks, wincing at the effort. His gaze finds her face, searching.

HUSBAND
(hoarse)
...Lin Yue? You look... older.

A broken laugh escapes her.

LIN YUE
Eight years, Shen Wei. You've been asleep for eight years.

He tries to sit up. She gently helps him.

HUSBAND
(weakly)
The fields... the taxes... the harvest...

LIN YUE
(softly)
I took care of it. I took care of everything.

His eyes drift around the room, landing on the humble surroundings. He notices the calluses on her hands, the wear in her face.

HUSBAND
(concerned)
You're thin. Have you... have you been well?

She avoids his gaze, smoothing the blanket.

LIN YUE
I'm fine. Rest now. I'll fetch the doctor.

HUSBAND
No. Stay. Tell me... tell me what happened. Why is everything... different?

She looks at him, the weight of years in her eyes.

LIN YUE
The world changed, Shen Wei. While you slept, I learned to move in the shadows. To take from those who have too much... and give to those who have nothing.

His brow furrows, confusion mixing with dawning alarm.

HUSBAND
Lin Yue... what have you done?

A GUARD'S VOICE shouts outside, distant but sharp.

GUARD (V.O.)
Search every house! The roads are sealed! Find Jade Hero!

Lin Yue stiffens. Shen Wei hears the fear in her silence. He reaches for her hand, his grip weak but urgent.

HUSBAND
(whispered)
You're... you're not just Lin Yue anymore, are you?

She doesn't answer. The silence is her confession.

EXT. COURTYARD - DAY

GUARDS pound past the gate. Their shouts fade. The courtyard is still.

INT. HUMBLE BEDROOM - DAY

Shen Wei closes his eyes, a tear slipping down his cheek.

HUSBAND
(very quiet)
Eight years... and I wake to find my wife has become a ghost.

Lin Yue bows her head, unable to speak.

LIN YUE
(whispered)
I did it for us. For them. For everyone you would have helped.

He opens his eyes, looking at her with profound sadness.

HUSBAND
And now? What now, Lin Yue? The world is awake, and so am I.

She looks toward the window, toward the sound of distant pursuit.

LIN YUE
(softly)
Now... I don't know.

all_cases.context:
Title: Rebellious Phase (Episode 34)
Description: A tense family dinner escalates into a confrontation when a daughter refuses to accept her mother's new husband.

INT. DINING ROOM - NIGHT

A family of three sits around the dinner table. The steaming food can't cut the chill between them.

LIU CILAN places a piece of chicken in her daughter's bowl.

LIU CILAN
The college entrance exam is in three weeks. You need protein.

LIN SU, eighteen, watches her mother's face as she moves it back.

LIN SU
So do you. Doctor's orders.

A beat. Then LIN SU sets down her chopsticks with a sharp click.

LIN SU
I'm not eating.

LIU CILAN
(angry)
What's gotten into you? Uncle Zhou spent all afternoon cooking. Sit down.

LIN SU
(pointing at ZHOU JIANCHEN)
Mom, you're defending him. Again.

LIU CILAN
(standing up, even more furious)
He's my husband. That makes him your father.

LIN SU
(sneering)

Title: Rebellious Phase (Episode 34)
Description: A tense family dinner escalates into a confrontation when a daughter refuses to accept her mother's new husband.

INT. DINING ROOM - NIGHT

A family of three sits around the dinner table. The steaming food can't cut the chill between them.

LIU CILAN places a piece of chicken in her daughter's bowl.

LIU CILAN

LIN SU, eighteen, watches her mother's face as she moves it back.

LIN SU
...
all_cases.continuation:
LIN SU
(sneering)
My father? My father is in the ground.

The words land like a plate shattering. ZHOU JIANCHEN, early forties, keeps his chopsticks suspended in midair.

LIU CILAN
(low, controlled)
Lin Su.

LIN SU
Don't "Lin Su" me. You didn't even wait a year.

LIU CILAN
(flaring)
Your dad has been gone three years!

LIN SU
And you forgot him in three months.

LIU CILAN slams her palm on the table. The soup ripples.

LIU CILAN
Enough!

ZHOU JIANCHEN
(gently)
Cilan. Let me.

He sets his chopsticks down carefully, like he's defusing something.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Lin Su, I know I can't replace your father. I never said I could.

LIN SU
Then stop sitting in his seat.

ZHOU JIANCHEN's eyes flick to the chair at the head of the table. It's subtle, but he registers it.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
(soft)
I can move.

He starts to stand.

LIU CILAN
(sharp)
Sit down.

He does. Her authority is immediate — more frightening because it isn't loud.

LIU CILAN
(to Lin Su)
You think you're the only one who misses him?

LIN SU
You miss him? Then why did you erase him?

LIU CILAN
I did not erase—

LIN SU
You took down his photo. You packed his clothes. You let someone else sleep in—

LIU CILAN
(interrupting)
Stop.

LIN SU holds her gaze, unblinking, as if daring her to deny it.

LIN SU
Did you even ask me? Or did you decide I was too busy studying to have feelings?

LIU CILAN
(stung)
I asked you to eat. I asked you to sleep. I asked you to go to school. You said nothing to me for months.

LIN SU
Because every time I opened my mouth, you told me to be "sensible."

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Lin Su—

LIN SU snaps her head toward him.

LIN SU
Don't call my name like you know me.

A beat.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
You're right. I don't.

He takes the hit, and for a moment the air softens — until LIU CILAN tightens it again.

LIU CILAN
You're eighteen. You can hate me if you want. But you will not disrespect him at this table.

LIN SU
This table?

She laughs once, bitter.

LIN SU
This is his table. His house. His life. And you're acting like it's a rental you can redecorate.

LIU CILAN
(voice cracking, then hardening)
Everything in this house is because I held it together.

LIN SU
No. You held it together so you could hand it to him.

ZHOU JIANCHEN's jaw works. He looks like he wants to disappear.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Cilan, it's fine. I can go to the kitchen.

LIU CILAN
(to Zhou, quiet)
Don't.

She turns back to her daughter.

LIU CILAN
You have three weeks before the exam. After that, you can choose whatever life you want. But right now, you will not throw your future away because you don't like my marriage.

LIN SU
My future?

She pushes her bowl away. The rice hasn't been touched.

LIN SU
You care about my future because it makes you look like a good mother.

LIU CILAN
That's not fair.

LIN SU
Fair?

LIN SU leans forward, eyes flashing.

LIN SU
Was it fair when you told me Dad died because "the road was slippery"?

LIU CILAN freezes.

ZHOU JIANCHEN's face tightens — he didn't expect that.

LIU CILAN
What are you talking about?

LIN SU
I went to the traffic bureau today.

LIU CILAN
(too fast)
Why would you—

LIN SU
Because I'm not stupid.

LIN SU pulls her phone out. Her thumb trembles as she scrolls. She shoves the screen toward her mother.

INSERT PHONE SCREEN - A blurry photo of a report: "SINGLE-VEHICLE COLLISION" with additional notes below.

LIN SU
(reading)
"Brake system anomaly." "Vehicle inspection pending." "Responsible party..."

She looks up, voice dropping.

LIN SU
It wasn't just "slippery."

LIU CILAN's eyes dart — a reflex. Guilt or fear, it's hard to tell.

LIU CILAN
Put that away.

LIN SU
Why?

LIU CILAN
Because you don't understand what you're looking at.

LIN SU
Then explain it to me. Explain why you never told me there was an investigation.

LIU CILAN
I told you what you needed to know.

LIN SU
No. You told me what was convenient.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
(careful)
Lin Su, your mom... she was protecting you.

LIN SU turns on him like a blade.

LIN SU
Protecting me from what? From the truth?

ZHOU JIANCHEN doesn't answer. He can't.

LIN SU looks between them and sees it — the shared silence, the practiced avoidance.

LIN SU
(quiet, dangerous)
You both know something.

LIU CILAN
(firm)
No.

LIN SU
Then look me in the eye and say it.

LIU CILAN meets her daughter's stare. The seconds stretch.

LIU CILAN
Your father had an accident. That's it.

LIN SU studies her mother like she's trying to identify a stranger.

LIN SU
You can lie to me. Fine.

She pockets the phone.

LIN SU
But don't tell me to accept him as my father when you won't even let me have mine.

LIU CILAN
Lin Su—

LIN SU stands so abruptly her chair scrapes the floor.

LIN SU
I'm not taking the exam.

The sentence hits harder than any insult.

LIU CILAN
(white-hot)
Try me.

LIN SU
I will. You can't force me to care.

LIU CILAN strides around the table, grabs LIN SU's wrist. Not brutal — desperate.

LIU CILAN
You're doing this to punish me.

LIN SU yanks her arm back.

LIN SU
No, Mom. I'm doing this because I'm finally allowed to.

LIU CILAN's hand hangs in the air, grasping at nothing.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Lin Su, don't—

LIN SU
(to Zhou)
If you're so good, stop hiding behind her.

ZHOU JIANCHEN flinches, then stands. For the first time, his calm cracks into something like resolve.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
I am not hiding.

LIU CILAN shoots him a warning look.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
(continuing)
Lin Su, your father's case... it wasn't closed properly.

LIU CILAN
(through clenched teeth)
Zhou Jianchen.

LIN SU's eyes sharpen, all attention.

LIN SU
What do you mean?

ZHOU JIANCHEN hesitates. The room holds its breath.

LIU CILAN steps between them, blocking the line like a human wall.

LIU CILAN
Go to your room.

LIN SU doesn't move.

LIN SU
Say it.

LIU CILAN
(louder)
Go. To. Your room.

LIN SU's stare flicks to ZHOU JIANCHEN — a silent dare. He looks at LIU CILAN, torn.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Cilan, she deserves—

LIU CILAN
(shouting)
She deserves to pass her exam!

A beat. The outburst leaves LIU CILAN raw, breathing hard.

LIN SU
(soft, cold)
So that's it. The exam is your god.

She turns and walks out.

INT. HALLWAY - CONTINUOUS

LIN SU storms down the hall, shoulders tight. Behind her, the dining room light spills out like a wound.

INT. LIN SU'S BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS

She slams the door, locks it, then leans against it, shaking.

She opens her phone again. Her finger hovers over a contact: "AUNT QIN."

She hits CALL.

INTERCUT - PHONE CALL

AUNT QIN (V.O.)
Lin Su? It's late. What's wrong?

LIN SU
Aunt Qin... did my dad ever... mention Zhou Jianchen?

Silence on the other end. Too long.

AUNT QIN (V.O.)
Where did you hear that name?

LIN SU's face drains.

LIN SU
So you do know.

CUT BACK TO:

INT. DINING ROOM - SAME TIME

LIU CILAN stands with her back to the table, staring at the hallway. ZHOU JIANCHEN watches her, guilt written all over him.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
(quiet)
She went to the bureau.

LIU CILAN
I know.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
Then we can't keep—

LIU CILAN whirls on him, eyes blazing with fear now, not anger.

LIU CILAN
You promised me.

ZHOU JIANCHEN swallows. His hands curl at his sides.

ZHOU JIANCHEN
I promised to protect her.

LIU CILAN's voice drops, shaking.

LIU CILAN
No. You promised to keep your mouth shut.

A hard beat.

From down the hall, muffled through a door, LIN SU's voice rises — urgent, trembling — just audible enough to haunt them.

LIN SU (O.S.)
Aunt Qin, tell me the truth. Tell me what happened to my dad.

LIU CILAN's face collapses.

ZHOU JIANCHEN closes his eyes, as if hearing a verdict.

FADE OUT.

Title: I'm Really Not a Hidden Master
Description: A simple village man practicing tai chi becomes the unexpected target of a forced marriage proposal from a powerful young lady who possesses extraordinary abilities.

INT. JIANG FAMILY HALL - DAY

JIANG CHEN, wearing a white practice outfit, practices tai chi in the courtyard. JIANG QILIN and JIANG ZHIHU sit at a tea table inside the room, drinking tea.

JIANG QILIN
Chen'er, how many times can you recite our Jiang family's ancestral teachings now?

JIANG ZHIHU
I can recite it nine times. Though the words about "hidden dragons" and "unseen storms" seemed like old men's fears... until today.

JIANG QILIN
(sipping tea slowly)
Some fears age into wisdom. When I was your age, I could only manage three repetitions before my hands shook too much to hold the scroll.

Suddenly, a loud bang. The main door is pushed open by an invisible force.

NING YANRAN and NING YUAN walk in.

JIANG CHEN, JIANG QILIN, and JIANG ZHIHU all look at them in surprise.

NING YANRAN
Jiang Chen of the Jiang family.

NING YANRAN
Sign it.

NING YANRAN throws a scroll onto the table. It unfurls with a soft, golden glow.

JIANG CHEN
Well, well, so you're here to break the engagement. Let me tell you, thirty years on the east side of the river—

NING YANRAN
(interrupting)
The betrothal stands. I am here to honor it.

JIANG CHEN picks up the scroll, unfolds it, and sees the words "Marriage Certificate" written in blood-red ink.

Title: I'm Really Not a Hidden Master
Description: A simple village man practicing tai chi becomes the unexpected target of a forced marriage proposal from a powerful young lady who possesses extraordinary abilities.

INT. JIANG FAMILY HALL - DAY

JIANG CHEN, wearing a white practice outfit, practices tai chi in the courtyard. JIANG QILIN and JIANG ZHIHU sit at a tea table inside the room, drinking tea.

JIANG QILIN
Chen'er, how many times can you recite our Jiang family's ancestral teachings no...
all_cases.continuation:
JIANG CHEN
(reading)
"Betrothal renewed... binding by blood and spirit..."

He sets the scroll down with a gentle sigh.

JIANG CHEN
I see. So the marriage contract is already written. Very thorough.

NING YANRAN
You will sign. Today.

JIANG CHEN
(after a pause)
If I refuse?

NING YANRAN
You won't.

Her voice carries a subtle tremor of power that makes the teacups on the table rattle.

JIANG QILIN
(quickly)
Chen'er! Sign it! For the family's sake!

JIANG ZHIHU
(whispering)
Elder sister, the Nie family... they wouldn't dare cross her.

JIANG CHEN
(looking at the scroll)
This ink... it's not ordinary red.

NING YANRAN
It's my blood. Mixed with binding ink. One drop per year of your life.

JIANG CHEN
(smiling faintly)
A generous offer. But I think I'll keep my years, if you don't mind.

NING YANRAN
You misunderstand. The drop is mine. Your signature seals the binding. My power anchors your promise.

JIANG CHEN
I see. So the marriage would be... binding in more than name.

NING YANRAN
Correct.

JIANG CHEN
(nodding slowly)
I understand. Very well.

He picks up the brush, dips it in the ink.

JIANG CHEN
(continuing)
If I sign... what happens to the Nie family?

NING YANRAN
They won't touch your family. Ever.

JIANG CHEN
And you?

NING YANRAN
I become your wife. In name. In duty. In protection.

JIANG CHEN
(pausing with the brush above the paper)
And if I... don't fulfill those duties? As a husband?

NING YANRAN
You will. I won't give you a choice.

JIANG CHEN
(smiling)
That sounds more like a threat than a wedding vow.

NING YANRAN
It's both.

JIANG CHEN
(after a long look at her)
Very well.

He signs.

The ink glows briefly, then fades.

NING YANRAN
(after a beat)
Good.

She picks up her half of the contract.

NING YANRAN
Tomorrow. Sunset. The western pavilion.

JIANG CHEN
I'll be there.

NING YANRAN
No. I will come to you.

She turns to leave, then pauses.

NING YANRAN
(without turning back)
Jiang Chen. You're calmer than I expected.

JIANG CHEN
I try to be. Especially when life gets... interesting.

NING YANRAN
Interesting.

She glances at him once more, then exits with Ning Yuan.

The door closes. Silence.

JIANG QILIN
(exhaling)
Chen'er... what have you gotten yourself into?

JIANG CHEN
(looking at the signed contract)
I think, Uncle Qilin, that I just got married.

He folds the scroll carefully.

JIANG CHEN
(continuing)
Though I suspect my wife has different expectations than I do.

JIANG QILIN
Different how?

JIANG CHEN
(smiling)
She expects me to be weak. I expect her to be... complicated.

He sets the scroll on the table and picks up his tea.

JIANG CHEN
(continuing, to himself)
Well. This should be... educational.

He sips the tea, his expression unreadable.

Title: Hidden Beauty
Description: After five years of unthinkable transformation, a scarred woman emerges with her enemy's perfect face to dismantle the family that destroyed her own.

INT. MEDICAL HALL - NIGHT

In a candlelit room, a woman in simple robes, SHEN ZHIYI, faces away from the camera, her face wrapped in bandages dark with fluid. She slowly raises a trembling hand and unwraps the final layer.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Five years. Two thousand nights of insects feeding on bone. All to wear your face.

The bandages fall away, revealing a delicate and beautiful face. She looks at herself in the mirror, her eyes flickering with disbelief and revulsion.

The witch doctor CAI YUE stands nearby.

SHEN ZHIYI
Cai Yue, do you think I look like Gu Xuerou?

FLASHBACK: A younger Shen crawls through broken glass, blood on her face, crying out in terror. Another woman in fine robes—GU XUEROU—laughs triumphantly as servants hold torches.

CAI YUE
Yes, exactly alike. Except your eyes hold what hers never could. The weight of having survived.

SHEN ZHIYI
(touching her own face)
Gu Xuerou, this time I will personally drag you down from your high position and trample you in the mud. I will return to you all the pain you inflicted, one by one.

SHEN ZHIYI's eyes are resolute as she clenches her fists tightly.
all_cases.context_excerpt:
Title: Hidden Beauty
Description: After five years of unthinkable transformation, a scarred woman emerges with her enemy's perfect face to dismantle the family that destroyed her own.

INT. MEDICAL HALL - NIGHT

In a candlelit room, a woman in simple robes, SHEN ZHIYI, faces away from the camera, her face wrapped in bandages dark with fluid. She slowly raises a trembling hand and unwraps the final layer.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Five years. Two thousand nights of insects feeding on bone. All to wear y...
all_cases.continuation:
CAI YUE crosses to a lacquered box. Opens it.

Inside: a thin jade hairpin, a small porcelain bottle, and a stack of paper bound with red string.

CAI YUE
Your skin will not forgive carelessness. Apply this every night. No wine. No hot springs. No anger that makes the face swell.

SHEN ZHIYI
(smiles without warmth)
Anger is the only thing that kept me alive.

CAI YUE
Then learn to hide it.

Cai Yue hands her the bound papers.

CAI YUE (CONT'D)
Everything I found about the Gu household. Their servants’ names, their habits, their debts. What they fear. What they desire.

Shen flips the first page.

On it — a careful sketch of GU XUEROU’s handwriting. Her seal. Her mannerisms, annotated like a dissected corpse.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
To become a person is easy.
To become a lie that no one dares doubt… takes blood.

SHEN ZHIYI
Where is the real Gu Xuerou?

Cai Yue’s eyes do not flicker.

CAI YUE
Far from here.

A pause.

SHEN ZHIYI watches Cai Yue, searching for the truth in the corners.

SHEN ZHIYI
Alive?

CAI YUE
You paid me to give you a face. Not a conscience.

Shen’s jaw tightens. She forces herself to breathe.

SHEN ZHIYI
Fine.

She takes the jade hairpin and lifts her long hair. Her fingers move with practiced grace — not her own, but memorized.

CAI YUE
There is one more thing.

Cai Yue takes a thin needle from the box. The tip glints.

CAI YUE (CONT'D)
Pain will return sometimes. Like ghosts in the nerves. When it does, do not scratch. Do not cry out. If you break the skin, you will show the seams.

Shen extends her hand.

SHEN ZHIYI
Do it.

Cai Yue presses the needle to a point beneath Shen’s ear — a small puncture. A bead of dark fluid rises.

Shen doesn’t flinch.

CAI YUE
That is the last drain. From now on, your body must accept the lie.

Shen stares at her reflection — GU XUEROU’S reflection — and speaks to it like an executioner.

SHEN ZHIYI
You stole my life.
Now I will wear yours until it rots.

She turns, robes whispering like a blade leaving its sheath.

CAI YUE
Where will you begin?

SHEN ZHIYI
At the door they slammed in my face.

She slips the papers into her sleeve.

SHEN ZHIYI (CONT'D)
At the Gu Manor.

CUT TO:

EXT. MOUNTAIN PATH - DAWN

Fog clings to pines. A narrow road cuts through rock.

A BLACK CARRIAGE waits with its lanterns dimmed.

Shen steps out from the medical hall in a hooded cloak. The sunrise catches her profile — flawless, expensive, untouchable.

A DRIVER bows low, not daring to look at her face.

DRIVER
Miss.

Shen pauses, savoring the word.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
“Miss.”
Once, they called me “that thing.”
Now even the air bends to this face.

She climbs into the carriage.

INT. CARRIAGE - MOVING - DAY

The wheels grind over stone.

Shen sits straight-backed. On her lap: the Gu dossier.

She opens to a page labeled: GU MANOR.

Handwritten notes:

— PATRIARCH GU ZHONGYAN: outward virtue, private cruelty.
— MADAM LIN: counts money like rosary beads.
— YOUNG MASTER GU JINGHAN: suspicious, sharp memory.
— SECOND DAUGHTER GU XUEROU: favored, petty, vindictive.
— ENGAGEMENT: set with the XIAO family, ties to court.

Shen traces the last line.

SHEN ZHIYI (internal monologue)
An engagement.
A rope they will all pull on.

She flips to another page: a list of servants.

Her eyes stop on one name.

“NIANG QIN — former wet nurse, knows childhood marks.”

Shen’s fingers still.

SHEN ZHIYI
(to herself)
Childhood marks…

She lifts her sleeve slightly, revealing smooth skin where a birthmark should be.

Shen reaches for the porcelain bottle Cai Yue gave her.

She uncorks it. The smell is bitter, medicinal.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
If a lie has holes, people will poke them with smiles.

She dabs the liquid behind her ear and along her jawline — not for beauty, for survival.

The carriage jolts. Outside, the sound of a distant city begins — bells, vendors, the murmur of many lives.

EXT. CAPITAL CITY - AFTERNOON

A bustling avenue. Red lanterns. Official banners. Guards in bright armor.

The carriage threads through crowds.

Shen watches through a small slit in the curtain.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Five years ago, I left this place with my face in rags.
Today, I return with theirs intact.

A beggar girl runs alongside the carriage, holding out a bowl.

BEGGAR GIRL
Lady, spare a coin!

Shen’s hand moves automatically toward her purse— then stops.

A memory flashes: her own hands, filthy, reaching through a cage.

Shen’s eyes harden. She draws the curtain shut.

SHEN ZHIYI (internal monologue)
Mercy is a luxury I can’t afford.

EXT. GU MANOR GATES - LATE AFTERNOON

The GU MANOR looms: stone lions, high walls, the kind of wealth that swallows sunlight.

Gu servants carry crates in and out. Guards stand rigid.

The carriage halts.

A STEWARD approaches, irritated, ready to scold—

Then Shen steps down.

The steward’s face drains of color. He drops to his knees.

STEWARD
Miss Xuerou…?!

Whispers ripple through the gate like wind through dry leaves.

SERVANT A
Is it really the Second Miss?

SERVANT B
I heard she was ill— sent away—!

Shen lowers her hood.

She offers a smile practiced from the dossier: sweet, entitled, slightly bored.

SHEN ZHIYI
Why are you all staring? Did the Gu family forget my face so quickly?

The steward trembles, half delighted, half afraid.

STEWARD
No, no— this servant would never— Please, Miss, quickly inside! Master will be overjoyed!

Shen steps forward.

At that moment, a voice cuts through the commotion — calm, sharp.

GU JINGHAN (O.S.)
Stop.

A young man in dark robes appears from within the gate: GU JINGHAN. Elegant, restrained, eyes like cold ink.

He looks at Shen as if measuring a painting for forgery.

GU JINGHAN (CONT'D)
Xuerou.

Shen meets his gaze without blinking.

A heartbeat too long.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
This is the one who reads people the way others read ledgers.
If he finds a crack, he will pry it open.

GU JINGHAN walks closer, slow.

GU JINGHAN
They said you were recovering in the south.
No letters.
No word.

His eyes flick to her hands, her posture, the angle of her chin.

GU JINGHAN (CONT'D)
You return… and you do not even bring a servant with you?

Shen lets out a small laugh — airy, dismissive — exactly as the dossier described.

SHEN ZHIYI
Brother, must I report my every breath to you now?

She steps past him as though she owns the earth beneath the stones.

GU JINGHAN’s gaze follows.

GU JINGHAN
(softly)
Your voice…

Shen stops. Turns just enough to show impatience.

SHEN ZHIYI
My voice?

GU JINGHAN
It sounds… calmer.

Shen smiles wider — a weapon wrapped in silk.

SHEN ZHIYI
Five years away from this house would calm anyone.

A beat. GU JINGHAN’s eyes narrow — not convinced, not accusing.

Just watching.

GU JINGHAN
Welcome home, then.

Shen inclines her head, perfect manners hiding perfect hatred.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Step one: enter the den.
Step two: let them believe the wolf is theirs.

She walks through the gate.

The GU MANOR doors swallow her.

CUT TO:

INT. GU MANOR - MAIN HALL - EVENING

Candles glow against carved wood. Incense hangs heavy, expensive.

GU ZHONGYAN sits at the head, dignified in public virtue. MADAM LIN sits beside him, eyes already wet with performative affection.

Servants line the walls like furniture.

Shen kneels in the center — the posture of a cherished daughter returning.

MADAM LIN
Xuerou… my child!

Madam Lin rushes down, grabbing Shen’s shoulders, searching her face as if to confirm the miracle.

Shen allows the embrace for exactly as long as propriety demands.

SHEN ZHIYI
Mother. I’ve returned.

Gu Zhongyan’s gaze sweeps over her, assessing — not love, but possession.

GU ZHONGYAN
Where have you been?

Shen looks up slowly, eyes shining with a controlled sadness.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Truth is wasted on butchers.

SHEN ZHIYI
I… don’t remember everything.

A ripple.

GU JINGHAN’s head lifts sharply.

Gu Zhongyan’s eyes harden, then soften into calculated concern.

GU ZHONGYAN
You don’t remember?

SHEN ZHIYI
After the fever… there are holes. Faces. Names. Some days I wake and my head is empty.

She touches her temple lightly — delicate, believable.

MADAM LIN
Heavens—! Then the physician was right, the shock damaged her—

GU JINGHAN
(to Shen)
What do you remember?

Shen turns her gaze to him — innocent on the surface, daring underneath.

SHEN ZHIYI
I remember home.

She looks around the hall, letting nostalgia coat every word.

SHEN ZHIYI (CONT'D)
I remember Father’s rules.
Mother’s incense.
Brother’s… stern face.

A few servants smile nervously.

Shen’s eyes drop — a hint of vulnerability, carefully measured.

SHEN ZHIYI (CONT'D)
And I remember… being afraid to disappoint you.

Gu Zhongyan stands, coming down one step like a benevolent god.

GU ZHONGYAN
If you truly cannot remember, then you will stay. Rest. We will not pressure you.

He reaches out and lifts her chin with two fingers — the gesture of a man checking a horse’s teeth.

GU ZHONGYAN (CONT'D)
You are Gu family blood. Nothing else matters.

Shen’s eyes flicker — a flash of something dark, swallowed instantly.

SHEN ZHIYI
Yes, Father.

GU JINGHAN watches, unmoving.

GU JINGHAN (V.O.)
(quiet, suspicious)
Her eyes changed.
Xuerou’s eyes were never this… deep.

Shen lowers her gaze, hiding the storm.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Let them feed me warmth.
I will spit it back as poison.

Gu Zhongyan turns to the servants.

GU ZHONGYAN
Prepare the Plum Courtyard. Double the guards. No one disturbs the Second Miss.

MADAM LIN
And call the Xiao family— they must know Xuerou is safe!

At the name, Shen’s lashes tremble — a feigned reaction.

SHEN ZHIYI
The Xiao family…?

Gu Zhongyan smiles, satisfied to see “confusion.”

GU ZHONGYAN
Your engagement. You truly forgot that too?

Shen inhales softly, as if struggling to grasp a memory.

SHEN ZHIYI
I forgot… but perhaps it will return.

She looks at the candle flame.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Bring him to me.
Bring them all.

GU JINGHAN takes a step forward.

GU JINGHAN
Father. If her memory is damaged, we should test it.

Madam Lin bristles.

MADAM LIN
Test? She just returned!

GU JINGHAN
Gently.

He looks directly at Shen.

GU JINGHAN (CONT'D)
What did you break when you were seven and blame on me?

The hall stills. Servants hold their breath.

Shen’s mind races — pages, annotations, details.

In the dossier: “Age seven — broke Madam Lin’s jade guanyin, cried, blamed Jinghan.”

Shen lets her eyes widen, then soften with a mischievous smile.

SHEN ZHIYI
Your inkstone. I dropped it— and you took the beating.

GU JINGHAN’s expression doesn’t change, but his eyes sharpen.

GU JINGHAN
That was when you were nine.

A trap.

Shen’s smile falters for half a heartbeat — then she laughs, covering.

SHEN ZHIYI
Was it? Then perhaps I really am muddled.

She reaches out, lightly touching his sleeve, intimate as siblings, dangerous as enemies.

SHEN ZHIYI (CONT'D)
Brother will forgive me. You always did.

GU JINGHAN looks down at her hand as if it’s a foreign insect.

GU JINGHAN
We will see.

Shen withdraws her hand gracefully.

Gu Zhongyan claps once, dismissing the tension with authority.

GU ZHONGYAN
Enough. She needs rest.

He turns to Shen, voice warm like honey over knives.

GU ZHONGYAN (CONT'D)
Go. Tomorrow, we speak of the Xiao marriage.

Shen bows.

SHEN ZHIYI
As Father wishes.

She rises, and for a brief instant, her eyes lift to Gu Zhongyan’s.

A silent promise.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Tomorrow, you will plan my wedding.
Soon, you will plan your funeral.

Shen exits with servants.

GU JINGHAN remains, watching the doorway long after she’s gone.

GU JINGHAN (V.O.)
That calmness… that patience…
Xuerou never had either.

He turns slightly to Gu Zhongyan.

GU JINGHAN
Father. Allow me to assign someone to watch the Plum Courtyard.

Gu Zhongyan nods without looking at him.

GU ZHONGYAN
Do what you must.

GU JINGHAN’s gaze stays on the shadows where Shen disappeared.

GU JINGHAN
(under his breath)
Who are you?

CUT TO:

INT. PLUM COURTYARD - SHEN’S ROOM - NIGHT

A luxurious room. Silk curtains. A mirror with gold inlay.

Servants leave, closing the doors.

Silence.

Shen walks to the mirror.

She stares at GU XUEROU’S face.

Her smile collapses.

SHEN ZHIYI (internal monologue)
They welcomed me.
They touched me.
They called me “daughter.”

Her fingers curl around the edge of the vanity so hard the wood creaks.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
If I let myself feel, I will hesitate.

She lifts the porcelain bottle and pours a drop onto her fingertip.

A hiss — faint, like acid meeting skin.

Shen winces, just once, pain breaking through discipline.

SHEN ZHIYI
(whisper)
Hold.

She presses the ointment along her jawline, as if sealing a mask.

Outside, distant footsteps pass — a guard changing shift.

Shen listens. Counts.

Then she opens the dossier to the last page — a folded letter, sealed with the GU FAMILY stamp.

She breaks it.

Inside: a single line in Cai Yue’s handwriting.

“THE REAL XUEROU IS NOT DEAD.
SHE IS SCREAMING SOMEWHERE.”

Shen’s breath catches.

Her reflection looks back with eyes that are not Gu Xuerou’s.

SHEN ZHIYI (V.O.)
Good.

She folds the letter carefully, tucks it against her heart.

SHEN ZHIYI
(low, to the mirror)
Scream louder.

She blows out the candle.

DARKNESS.

FADE OUT.

all_cases.context:
Title: Arranged Marriage Pressure
Description: A young woman faces mounting pressure from her traditional parents to find a husband and continue the family legacy, but she resists their matchmaking attempts.

MONTAGE

A series of photos on a bedroom wall: XU SUINING and a young man, laughing at a carnival, cooking together, hiking. She removes the last photo, her face stoic.

TRANSITION

TITLE: Three Years Later

EXT. CITY LANDSCAPE - DAY

Aerial shots of a modern metropolis, a magnificent bridge spanning across the river.

INT. XU FAMILY ANCESTRAL HALL - DAY

The ancestral hall is solemn and dignified, with memorial tablets of the Xu ancestors. XU YAQING, the Xu clan matriarch, kneels on a cushion, her posture rigid with prayer.

XU YAQING
(whispering fervently)
Ancestors, grant me strength... before the business crumbles and I do.

XU HAITAO, Xu Yaqing's husband, shuffles in holding a thick photo album. It slips from his hands, pages scattering with a fluttering sound.

XU SUINING
(startled)
Dad!

XU HAITAO
(apologetic)
Clumsy old man.

XU HAITAO gathers photos, offering one to his daughter who doesn't take it.

XU HAITAO
(holding up photo)
This one runs a startup.

XU SUINING
He looks like the startup is a pyramid scheme.

XU HAITAO
(flipping page)
Architect. Good bones.

XU SUINING
(in unison with XU YAQING)
And knows it.
