TRANSITION

TITLE: Three Years Later

EXT. CITY LANDSCAPE - DAY

Aerial shots of a modern metropolis, a magnificent bridg...
all_cases.continuation:
A beat. The shared assessment hangs in the incense-thick air.

XU HAITAO
(trying again)
Okay, okay. Then... this one.

He flips to another page. A young man in a crisp suit, smiling a little too hard.

XU SUINING
He smiles like he charges by the sentence.

XU YAQING
(still kneeling)
At least he smiles.

XU SUINING
So do salesmen before they lock the door.

XU YAQING opens her eyes, the prayer finished. She doesn't stand yet.

XU YAQING
Sui Ning.

XU SUINING
Mm?

XU YAQING
Kneel.

XU SUINING looks at the cushions. Then at her mother's back. A familiar battlefield.

XU SUINING
If I kneel, will the ancestors Venmo you strength?

XU HAITAO
Sui Ning...

XU SUINING
(to her father)
Dad, stay out of it. You're still recovering from "Architect. Good bones."

XU HAITAO
(defensive)
He had good bones.

XU YAQING
Enough.

The word is quiet. It lands like a gavel.

XU SUINING exhales and kneels beside her mother—more out of love than obedience.

XU YAQING
(eyes forward)
Three years.

XU SUINING
(too casual)
Three years and two months, if we’re counting the time you pretended not to know my address.

XU HAITAO winces.

XU YAQING
Three years since you said you would come back to help.

XU SUINING
I did come back.

XU YAQING
To visit. Like a relative who brings fruit and leaves before the door closes.

XU SUINING
(softening)
I’m here now.

XU YAQING finally turns. Her face is composed, but the skin around her eyes is pulled tight from sleepless nights.

XU YAQING
Do you know what "here" looks like?

XU SUINING
Ancestral hall. Incense. Guilt.

XU YAQING
It looks like creditors.

XU HAITAO
(interrupting, hurried)
Not— not creditors. Just... partners. People who want to talk.

XU SUINING
People who want to take.

XU YAQING
They already are.

A silence. Even XU HAITAO stops flipping pages.

XU SUINING
What happened?

XU YAQING
What happened is that your father believed a man who said "temporary cash flow issue" like it was a blessing.

XU HAITAO
(deflated)
He had a government stamp.

XU SUINING
So do parking tickets.

XU YAQING
And your uncle— your uncle signed away the warehouse as collateral without telling me.

XU SUINING
Uncle Xu signed something without reading it? Shocking.

XU YAQING
We have ninety days.

XU SUINING’s sarcasm fades. She glances up at the memorial tablets—names carved with certainty, as if the future was guaranteed.

XU SUINING
Ninety days for what?

XU YAQING
For the bank to swallow the factory. For the Xu name to become a story people tell with their mouths covered.

XU HAITAO
(quietly)
For us to lose the ancestral land.

XU SUINING
So this is why we're flipping through men like coupons.

XU YAQING
This is why you will meet someone.

XU SUINING
No.

XU YAQING
Yes.

XU SUINING
Mom, marriage is not a loan extension.

XU YAQING
In this city, it is.

She reaches into her sleeve and pulls out a RED INVITATION CARD—thick paper, embossed gold.

XU YAQING (CONT'D)
Tonight. Li family banquet.

XU SUINING
(laughs once)
Li family.

XU HAITAO
(too bright)
Very nice family. Very... solvent.

XU SUINING
So it’s business.

XU YAQING
Everything has always been business. Even you.

That hits harder than the bank.

XU SUINING
(voice low)
Don’t say that.

XU YAQING
Then don't act like a guest in your own bloodline.

XU SUINING stands abruptly. The cushion shifts, scraping the stone.

XU SUINING
You want me to save the factory, fine. I can look at the books. I can renegotiate. I can work.

XU YAQING
And while you work, what do you give them?

XU SUINING
A plan.

XU YAQING
They don't want your plan. They want your promise.

XU SUINING
My promise isn’t for sale.

XU YAQING
(standing now, steady)
Your promise was made the day you were born into this house.

XU SUINING
And what about what I want?

XU YAQING
I want the Xu name to survive. I want the tablets to stay on these shelves. I want your father to stop waking up at four in the morning to count debts in his head.

XU HAITAO
(weak)
It's actually three-thirty.

XU SUINING looks at her father—older than he should be, fingers still smudged with incense ash from picking up photos.

XU SUINING
You could’ve told me.

XU HAITAO
We did tell you.

XU SUINING
No. You hinted. You sighed. You sent me pictures of men like... like bait.

XU YAQING
Because if we said it plainly, you would run.

XU SUINING
Maybe I would’ve come back sooner.

A thin crack appears in XU YAQING’s composure—an almost-flinch, quickly sealed.

XU YAQING
Tonight. You will wear something proper. You will smile. You will not embarrass us.

XU SUINING
What if I embarrass the Li family?

XU YAQING
Then they will embarrass us back. And they will do it in court.

XU SUINING stares at the red invitation card in her mother's hand as if it’s a summons.

XU SUINING
Who is it?

XU HAITAO
(relieved to speak)
Li Zhen. Their eldest.

XU SUINING
And what is he? Startup? Architect? Bones?

XU HAITAO
He runs Li Capital.

XU SUINING
Oh. So he buys companies the way you buy fish at the market.

XU YAQING
He buys what he wants. And right now, he wants to meet you.

XU SUINING
Or he wants to meet our assets.

XU YAQING
Same thing.

XU SUINING takes the invitation from her mother. Her fingers press into the raised gold letters.

XU SUINING
I’ll go.

XU HAITAO exhales like he’s been holding his breath for three years.

XU YAQING
Good.

XU SUINING
But I’m not agreeing to anything.

XU YAQING
Tonight is not about agreement. It's about opening a door.

XU SUINING
Doors can close.

XU YAQING
Not if you stand in them.

XU SUINING pockets the invitation, expression unreadable.

XU SUINING
I’ll look at the books first.

XU YAQING
After dinner.

XU SUINING
Before dinner. If I’m going to sit across from a man who buys companies, I want to know exactly what he thinks he’s buying.

A beat. XU YAQING studies her daughter—seeing the child who ran, and the woman who came back with sharper edges.

XU YAQING
(quiet)
Fine. Two hours.

XU HAITAO
I'll make tea.

XU SUINING
Don't. Last time you made tea, you used the ceremonial leaves from Great-Grandfather’s memorial.

XU HAITAO
(confessing)
It tasted expensive.

XU YAQING shoots him a look that could burn incense without a flame.

CUT TO:

INT. XU FAMILY STUDY - DAY

A heavy wooden desk. Ledgers stacked like bricks. A laptop open—new in this old room.

XU SUINING sits, sleeves rolled up. Her eyes move fast across spreadsheets and scanned contracts.

On the wall: an old framed photo of the factory opening day. Smiling faces. Fresh paint. Promise.

XU HAITAO hovers with a tray of tea, uncertain if he’s allowed to breathe.

XU HAITAO
I used the normal leaves.

XU SUINING
Good. Keep them normal.

She scrolls. Stops.

XU SUINING (CONT'D)
This loan.

XU HAITAO
Which one?

XU SUINING
The one where the interest rate climbs every quarter like it’s training for a marathon.

XU HAITAO
(nervous chuckle)
They said it's standard.

XU SUINING
It's standard if you’re trying to kill someone politely.

She clicks into another file—an email chain with LI CAPITAL letterhead.

XU SUINING (CONT'D)
Li Capital is already here.

XU HAITAO
They... they offered consultation.

XU SUINING
They offered a leash.

XU YAQING enters without knocking. She has changed—dark qipao, hair pinned with surgical precision. Ready for war disguised as dinner.

XU YAQING
You’re done?

XU SUINING
Not even close.

XU YAQING
We leave in one hour.

XU SUINING
Then I’ll be half done.

XU YAQING
Half done doesn't stop a bank.

XU SUINING looks up.

XU SUINING
Neither does a banquet.

XU YAQING
A banquet stops pride. It stops rumors. It stops doors from closing.

XU SUINING
And it opens cages.

XU YAQING
If you see it as a cage, then you’ve already decided you’re trapped.

XU SUINING
Maybe I just know what a cage looks like.

The room tightens—unspoken history pressing in.

XU HAITAO
(soft, to break it)
We should go. It's the Li family. They don't like people being late.

XU SUINING
Of course they don’t.

She closes the laptop with finality.

XU SUINING (CONT'D)
I’ll go. I’ll smile. I’ll even let him talk.

XU YAQING
And?

XU SUINING
And I’ll decide what I’m willing to trade.

XU YAQING
You don’t have the luxury of deciding alone.

XU SUINING stands, meeting her mother’s eyes.

XU SUINING
Watch me.

CUT TO:

EXT. LI FAMILY PRIVATE CLUB - NIGHT

A sleek entrance, discreet wealth. Valets in black gloves. Guests in tailored suits and silk dresses.

The XU FAMILY car pulls up. XU YAQING steps out first, composed. XU HAITAO follows, adjusting his tie. XU SUINING exits last—simple black dress, hair down, face calm like a blade.

Across the entrance, a man turns as if he sensed her.

LI ZHEN (early 30s), polished without being flashy. His gaze is direct, assessing, patient.

He walks toward them with measured confidence.

LI ZHEN
Mrs. Xu.

XU YAQING’s smile appears—perfect, practiced.

XU YAQING
Mr. Li. Thank you for inviting us.

LI ZHEN
It’s an honor.

His eyes shift to XU SUINING—no hurry, no embarrassment at looking closely.

LI ZHEN (CONT'D)
And this must be Xu Suining.

XU SUINING offers her hand.

XU SUINING
Must be.

A small pause—LI ZHEN’s mouth twitches, amused.

LI ZHEN
I appreciate punctuality.

XU SUINING
Then you’ll appreciate that I didn’t come for free.

XU YAQING’s smile holds. XU HAITAO swallows.

LI ZHEN studies her, then nods as if that was the correct password.

LI ZHEN
Good. Neither did I.

He gestures toward the doors.

LI ZHEN (CONT'D)
Shall we?

XU SUINING steps forward, eyes on the entrance like it might lock behind her.

She walks anyway.
all_cases.continuation_excerpt:
A beat. The shared assessment hangs in the incense-thick air.

XU HAITAO
(trying again)
Okay, okay. Then... this one.

He flips to another page. A young man in a crisp suit, smiling a little too hard.

XU SUINING
He smiles like he charges by the sentence.

XU YAQING
(still kneeling)
At least he smiles.

XU SUINING
So do salesmen before they lock the door.

XU YAQING opens her eyes, the prayer finished. She doesn't stand yet.

XU YAQING
Sui Ning.

XU SUINING
Mm?

XU YAQING
Kneel.

XU SUINING looks at the cushions. Then at her mother's back. A familiar battlefield.

XU SUINING
If I kneel, will the ancestors Venmo you strength?

XU HAITAO
Sui Ning...

XU SUINING
(to her father)
Dad, stay out of it. You're still recovering from "Architect. Good bones."

XU HAITAO
(defensive)
He had good bones....

all_cases.context:
Title: A Good Wife Brings Prosperity
Description: A successful CEO returns to his hometown after ten years to marry his childhood sweetheart who supported him through poverty, fulfilling his promise with a fortune.

INT. CELEBRATION VENUE - DAY

Music plays, the atmosphere is lively. LI ZICHEN, in a sharp suit, full of confidence, strikes the listing gong.

The backdrop reads: "Congratulations to Zichen Group on surpassing 100 billion market value upon listing."

Everyone applauds.

ON SCREEN: President of Zichen Group - LI ZICHEN

CROWD
Congratulations to Zichen Group, 100 billion market value, successful listing!

SECRETARY WANG, wearing glasses in professional attire, holds a microphone and asks a question.

ON SCREEN: Li Zichen's Secretary - SECRETARY WANG

SECRETARY WANG
Mr. Li, what has supported you in achieving such success?

LI ZICHEN takes the microphone, his gaze profound.

LI ZICHEN
The woman who taught me that dignity isn't bought with money—it's earned through keeping your word. Even when I couldn't reach her for ten years.

INT. WANG FAMILY DINING TABLE - DAY (TEN YEARS AGO)

ON SCREEN: Ten years ago - Tingling Village

Flashback to ten years ago. Young LI ZICHEN, WANG TINGTING, and Tingting's father WANG CHANGSHUN sit around a simple dining table eating.

WANG TINGTING picks up a piece of chicken and places it in LI ZICHEN's bowl.

WANG TINGTING
Brother Zichen, eat more.

WANG CHANGSHUN sees this and slams his chopsticks on the table with a loud bang.

WANG CHANGSHUN
Eat, eat, eat, all you know is eating!

ON SCREEN: Wang Tingting's Father - WANG CHANGSHUN

WANG CHANGSHUN
A waste who's been living off our family for over ten years!

WANG TINGTING
Dad, how can you say that about Brother Zichen?

WANG CHANGSHUN
I need to make him recognize his place!

ON SCREEN: Li Zichen's Childhood Sweetheart - WANG TINGTING

WANG CHANGSHUN
The son of a convict, a waste who only knows how to study! He needs to give up any idea of climbing high and marrying you!

EXT. WANG FAMILY COURTYARD - DAY (TEN YEARS AGO)

The three argue as they come to the courtyard.

LI ZICHEN
I'm not a waste!

WANG CHANGSHUN
Not a waste? If you're not a waste, why have you been freeloading at our house for over ten years? Tuition and living expenses, didn't Tingting pay for them all? What are you if not a waste? At least a dog can guard the house when you feed it. What can you do?

WANG TINGTING
(interrupting)
Dad! I lent him that money—he refused three times before taking it. And I'll leave with him tonight if I must!

WANG CHANGSHUN
(pointing at LI ZICHEN)
You want to marry him? Over my dead body!

WANG CHANGSHUN storms into the house and slams the door hard.

WANG TINGTING
Dad! Dad!

LI ZICHEN holds back the heartbroken WANG TINGTING. He pulls out a jade pendant.

LI ZICHEN
Uncle Changshun is right. Being poor means having no dignity. So I'm going out to make something of myself, then I'll come back to marry you. Sell this if you need to. I won't touch another cent of yours.

The backdrop reads: "Congratulations to Zichen Group on surpassing 100 billion market value upon listing."

ON SCREEN: P...
all_cases.continuation:
WANG TINGTING shakes her head vigorously, tears streaming down her face, but she clutches the pendant tightly against her chest.

WANG TINGTING
I won't sell it! I don't care about dignity or money. I just want you!

LI ZICHEN
(voice trembling)
If I stay, I'll never be able to lift my head in front of your father. I can't let you suffer with a "waste" for the rest of your life.

He steps back, looking at her one last time, etching her face into his memory.

LI ZICHEN
Wait for me. When I return, I'll make sure no one ever looks down on us again.

WANG TINGTING
(choking back sobs)
I'll wait! Even if it takes a lifetime, I'll wait for you, Brother Zichen!

LI ZICHEN grits his teeth, turns around, and runs out of the courtyard without looking back.

INT. CELEBRATION VENUE - DAY (PRESENT)

The memory fades. LI ZICHEN stands on stage, gripping the microphone, his eyes slightly red but burning with determination.

The audience is silent, captivated by his raw emotion.

LI ZICHEN
For ten years, I didn't dare contact her. I was afraid that if I heard her voice, I would give up the fight and run back to her with nothing.

He looks directly into the camera lens.

LI ZICHEN
But today, I have fulfilled my part of the bargain.

He hands the microphone to a stunned SECRETARY WANG and strides off the stage.

The crowd erupts into thunderous applause.

EXT. CELEBRATION VENUE - DAY

LI ZICHEN walks briskly toward a waiting Rolls Royce. SECRETARY WANG hurries to keep up, her high heels clicking rapidly on the pavement.

SECRETARY WANG
President Li! The investors are waiting for the banquet. The media wants a photo session—

LI ZICHEN
Cancel it.

SECRETARY WANG
(stops)
Cancel it? But sir, the stock price just hit the limit up. This is the most important moment of your career.

LI ZICHEN
(stopping and turning)
I spent ten years building a hundred-billion-dollar empire for one reason. To have the confidence to stand in front of that door again. Without her, this money is just paper.

He opens the car door himself.

LI ZICHEN
Prepare the convoy. We're going to Tingling Village. And bring the bridal gift list I prepared.

SECRETARY WANG
(adjusting her glasses, realizing)
Yes, President Li.

INT. ROLLS ROYCE - LATER

The luxury car speeds down a highway. LI ZICHEN looks out the window, clutching a small, velvet jewelry box in his hand.

SECRETARY WANG sits opposite him, looking at a tablet. Her expression shifts to worry.

SECRETARY WANG
President Li, I just received a report from the advance team in the county.

LI ZICHEN
Speak.

SECRETARY WANG
Regarding the Wang family... there seems to be a situation.

LI ZICHEN
(coldly)
Is it Wang Changshun again?

SECRETARY WANG
It's... a wedding. The Wang family is holding a wedding banquet today.

LI ZICHEN's eyes widen. His grip on the velvet box tightens, his knuckles turning white. The air in the car instantly drops in temperature.

LI ZICHEN
(low, dangerous voice)
Who is the groom?

SECRETARY WANG
The son of the village chief. It's said... it's to pay off your childhood debts that Wang Changshun claims you owe.

LI ZICHEN
(sneering)
Wang Changshun. You truly haven't changed.

LI ZICHEN leans forward to the driver partition.

LI ZICHEN
Drive faster. If we're late, don't bother coming to work tomorrow.

Title: Rather Die Than Submit
Description: A young girl confronts the Emperor on the street, claiming he is her father, shocking the crowd who believed he came to select concubines.

EXT. ANCIENT STREET - DAY

SOLDIERS in crimson armor shove forward, their spear-butts thudding against cobblestones. DESPERATE WOMEN clutch hand-painted portraits and wilting lotus blossoms, pressing against the soldiers' shields.

SOLDIER
Make way! Make way! By order of the Crown Prince!

Shoving intensifies. A crone's basket spills—dates scatter, trampled underfoot.

From a shadowed doorway, YUEYUE (9, filthy, in threadbare hemp) clutches a silk scroll. She unrolls it: a vibrant imperial portrait with edges worn by countless secret viewings.

At the procession's head, PRINCE XIAO CHENGRUI (30s, cold-eyed) surveys the crowd like a falcon. Behind his mount, the Emperor's carriage—black lacquer, unadorned, its curtains sealed tight.

WOMAN A
(voice cracking)
Ten years... ten years since any woman entered the Jade Pavilion!

WOMAN B
(shoving a painting through a guard's arm)
The astrologers said the Phoenix Star aligns today! He must choose!

XIAO CHENGRUI wheels his horse toward the carriage, his voice low but cutting.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Imperial Brother. Mother grows desperate. You grace these filthy streets for temple incense while your throne stands heirless. She demands you return with at least three new consorts.

He straightens in his saddle, suddenly projecting his voice for the masses.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Hear this! His Majesty rides today for the Temple of Heaven's Blessing—not for any lowborn selection!

A groan ripples through the crowd. Hope falters.

XIAO CHENGRUI
(silkily)

Description: A young girl confronts the Emperor on the street, claiming he is her father, shocking the crowd who believed he came to select concubines.

EXT. ANCIENT STREET - DAY

SOLDIERS in crimson armor shove forward, their spear-butts thudding against cobblestones. DESPERATE WOMEN clutch hand-painted portraits and wilting lotus blossoms, pressing against the soldiers' shields.

SOLDIER
Make way! Make way! By order of the Crown Prince!

Shoving intensifies. A cro...
all_cases.continuation:
XIAO CHENGRUI
(silkily)
But if any loyal subject bears a *petition* for His Majesty—step forward. Do not waste the Emperor's mercy with sobbing and superstition.

He lifts a gloved hand.

SOLDIERS immediately begin dragging women out of the crush, lining them up as if for inspection. The crowd's moans turn into frantic bargaining.

WOMAN A
He's choosing after all!

WOMAN B
(whispering, terrified)
No—it's to punish those who dared hope.

YUEYUE watches, jaw tight. Her tiny fingers whiten around the scroll.

A SOLDIER yanks a girl of sixteen by the wrist. She stumbles, crying.

Something in YUEYUE snaps.

She darts out from the doorway and into the open street.

SOLDIER
Hey—!

YUEYUE
(shouting)
His Majesty!

Heads whip. Even the horses flinch.

XIAO CHENGRUI's eyes narrow—annoyed at a child daring to break his procession.

YUEYUE runs straight toward the black-lacquer carriage.

SOLDIERS surge to intercept—

YUEYUE yanks the scroll up high. The imperial portrait catches sunlight like a blade.

YUEYUE
I have a petition!

A SOLDIER reaches—

YUEYUE
(panicked, louder)
Don't touch it!

The soldier hesitates. Superstition. Fear of defiling an imperial image.

YUEYUE plants herself before the carriage, breathing hard, filthy knees in the dust.

YUEYUE
(voice shaking)
Father.

Silence drops over the street like a curtain.

WOMAN A
Did she just—

WOMAN B
She's dead.

XIAO CHENGRUI's mouth curves—almost amused, almost murderous.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Impudent little thing. The Emperor has no daughters.

YUEYUE's chin lifts, stubborn beyond her years.

YUEYUE
Then why does his face hang in my home?

She thrusts the portrait forward, the worn edges exposing countless secret touches.

YUEYUE
Why did my mother bow to it when she was dying?

A murmur—hungry, scandalized—ripples through the crowd.

XIAO CHENGRUI
(to soldiers)
Take her. Seal her mouth.

Two SOLDIERS grab for YUEYUE—

She doesn't retreat. She throws her arms wide, standing between them and the carriage as if her small body can block an empire.

YUEYUE
If you want me gone, kill me here!

Her eyes burn—wet but unflinching.

YUEYUE
I'd rather die than submit to lies.

The words hit the crowd. Even the desperate women straighten, stunned by the child's defiance.

XIAO CHENGRUI's expression hardens. A flicker of calculation.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Careful. To slander His Majesty is—

A voice cuts through from behind the sealed curtains.

EMPEROR (V.O.)
Enough.

The soldiers freeze mid-grab. The street seems to stop breathing.

XIAO CHENGRUI turns sharply toward the carriage, smile returning in a controlled line.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Imperial Brother. This is beneath your attention. A beggar child seeking coin with a stolen likeness—

The curtain stirs.

A single pale hand appears, pushing it aside from within.

YUEYUE's breath catches. She drops to her knees instinctively—then forces herself back upright, refusing to bow fully.

The carriage door unlatches.

A thin slice of darkness opens—

And the EMPEROR steps down.

He is younger than the rumors suggest, dressed in unadorned dark robes, his face austere as carved stone. His gaze moves to the portrait first, then to the girl's soot-streaked face.

No one dares speak.

The Emperor kneels—an impossible act—bringing his eyes level with YUEYUE.

EMPEROR
(low, precise)
What is your name?

YUEYUE swallows. Her throat works like she's trying to push blood back into her voice.

YUEYUE
Yueyue.

The Emperor's eyes tighten by a hair—recognition or pain, too quick to name.

XIAO CHENGRUI
(smiling, warning)
A child can be taught any name, Imperial Brother.

The Emperor doesn't look at him.

EMPEROR
(to Yueyue)
Who told you to come here?

YUEYUE
No one.

She lifts the scroll again, holding it like testimony.

YUEYUE
My mother said if I ever had no way to live... I should find you.

A beat.

YUEYUE
She said you would know her.

The Emperor's gaze sharpens, finally turning.

EMPEROR
Her name.

YUEYUE hesitates, then speaks as if reciting a sacred thing.

YUEYUE
Shen Jinzhi.

A tiny tremor passes through the Emperor's composure—just enough to be real.

Around them, the crowd shudders with the realization: this isn't a street trick.

XIAO CHENGRUI's eyes flash.

XIAO CHENGRUI
That name is forbidden.

The Emperor rises slowly.

EMPEROR
Then it should not be spoken lightly.

He looks down at YUEYUE, voice quieter—dangerous in its restraint.

EMPEROR
Come.

YUEYUE doesn't move. She stares up at him, fierce and frightened all at once.

YUEYUE
If I go with you... will they stop trying to take girls?

The Emperor's eyes flick to the line of trembling women held by soldiers.

He answers without comfort, without performance.

EMPEROR
Today, yes.

YUEYUE
And tomorrow?

The question hangs—too bold for a child, too sharp for a court.

XIAO CHENGRUI steps forward, tone smooth.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Imperial Brother, you're indulging her. A public spectacle invites rumors. The ministers—

EMPEROR
(turning, cold)
You invited the spectacle.

XIAO CHENGRUI's smile falters.

The Emperor extends a hand to YUEYUE.

She looks at it like it's a trap—then like it's all she has.

She places her small, dirty fingers into his.

The crowd exhales, half in awe, half in dread.

The Emperor leads her toward the carriage.

XIAO CHENGRUI watches them, eyes darkening as the street tilts away from his control.

XIAO CHENGRUI
(soft, to himself)
A daughter.

His gaze drops to YUEYUE's scroll—the portrait—the worn edges.

XIAO CHENGRUI
And proof.

He lifts his voice, honey over steel.

XIAO CHENGRUI
Imperial Brother. Shall I have the child examined? If she claims imperial blood, the rites demand verification.

The Emperor pauses at the carriage step.

EMPEROR
Without you.

XIAO CHENGRUI's jaw tightens.

EMPEROR
(to the soldiers)
Clear the street. Anyone who speaks her name today loses their tongue.

The command slices through the air. The crowd recoils.

SOLDIERS shove people back with sudden ferocity, forming a wall.

YUEYUE is pulled into the shadow of the carriage, the curtain falling behind her like a closing gate.

For a brief instant—through the gap—her eyes find the crowd.

Not pleading.

Warning.

The curtain seals.

The carriage begins to roll.

XIAO CHENGRUI remains in the street, crimson cloak snapping in the wind, watching the black lacquer disappear toward the palace.

His smile returns—empty.

XIAO CHENGRUI
(to his captain, quiet)
Find out where that girl came from.

CAPTAIN
Yes, Your Highness.

XIAO CHENGRUI
And whether Shen Jinzhi has any other... ghosts.

He mounts his horse, heels it forward, following the carriage like a shadow that has learned to ride.

CUT TO:

INT. IMPERIAL CARRIAGE - MOVING - DAY

Dim. Incense clings to the air, old and untouched.

YUEYUE sits rigid on the lacquered bench, hands clenched in her lap. The scroll lies across her knees like a shield.

Across from her, the EMPEROR watches in silence.

The rumble of wheels fills the space where questions should be.

Finally—

EMPEROR
Where is your mother buried?

YUEYUE's eyes flicker.

YUEYUE
I don't know.

She swallows the shame.

YUEYUE
They threw her with the others.

The Emperor's gaze drops—just once—to her small, bruised wrists.

EMPEROR
Who is "they"?

YUEYUE
Everyone.

A beat.

YUEYUE
And the man who said he would feed us... if my mother smiled at him.

The Emperor's hand tightens on his sleeve. A controlled inhale.

EMPEROR
You came alone.

YUEYUE
Yes.

EMPEROR
No one followed?

YUEYUE's mouth twists. Bitter, childlike.

YUEYUE
Who would follow me? I'm filthy.

She looks up, eyes daring.

YUEYUE
Will you still say I'm lying when we're inside your walls?

The Emperor holds her gaze—an emperor measuring a child, a man measuring a wound.

EMPEROR
If you are lying, you will die.

YUEYUE doesn't flinch.

YUEYUE
Then kill me.

A beat.

YUEYUE
But if I'm not...

The Emperor's eyes darken.

EMPEROR
If you are not... then many will wish you had died today.

The carriage jolts over a stone. The sound of distant gates begins—massive, echoing.

YUEYUE's fingers curl around the portrait until her knuckles pale.

YUEYUE
Then teach me how to live.

The Emperor looks away—toward the sealed curtain, toward the palace waiting like a blade.

EMPEROR
First, you learn how to be silent.

The gates BOOM open.

Light spills in as the carriage passes through.

YUEYUE stares into it, unblinking.

FADE OUT.

Title: Baby's Wild Ride Episode 1
Description: A woman betrayed by her family gives birth in secret, loses her child, and is forced to take the fall for her sister's crimes, vowing revenge from prison.

INT. BEDROOM - DAY

SONG YUAN lies on the bed, screaming in pain, giving birth.

MRS. SONG and SONG XIYUE rush into the room.

MRS. SONG
(contemptuous)
Screaming won't erase your disgrace. You couldn't even name the father.

SONG YUAN
(agonized)
I don't... remember. Just save my baby.

MRS. SONG
A bastard has no place in the Song family.

SONG YUAN lets out a piercing scream. The BABY'S CRY is cut short.

FADE TO BLACK.

SONG YUAN
(agonized)
I don't... remember. Just save my baby.

MRS. SONG
...
all_cases.continuation:
INT. BEDROOM - LATER

SONG YUAN lies exhausted, sweat-soaked, reaching weakly toward the door.

SONG YUAN
(desperate)
My baby... let me see my baby...

MRS. SONG returns, her face cold as stone. She carries nothing in her arms.

MRS. SONG
It's done. The child is gone.

SONG YUAN
(screaming)
No! Where is my baby?! What did you do?!

She tries to rise but collapses, too weak from the birth.

SONG XIYUE
(feigning sympathy)
Sister, it's better this way. Think of the family's reputation.

SONG YUAN
(sobbing)
You monsters... you killed my child...

MRS. SONG
(coldly)
We saved this family from your shame. Now rest. You have another duty to perform.

INT. SONG FAMILY LIVING ROOM - THREE DAYS LATER

SONG YUAN, pale and barely able to stand, is dragged downstairs by two SERVANTS. POLICE OFFICERS wait by the door.

MR. SONG stands beside SONG XIYUE, who clutches a handkerchief to her eyes.

MR. SONG
(to the officers)
This is her. My eldest daughter. She embezzled the company funds.

SONG YUAN
(shocked)
What? Father, I never—

SONG XIYUE
(crying)
Sister, how could you? I trusted you with the accounts!

SONG YUAN
(realizing)
You... this was you. You're framing me!

OFFICER #1
Ma'am, we have documents with your signature. You need to come with us.

SONG YUAN
(to her family, betrayed)
I just lost my child, and now you do this?

MRS. SONG
(turning away)
Take her. She's no daughter of ours.

The officers handcuff SONG YUAN. She stares at her family with dawning hatred.

SONG YUAN
(low, venomous)
I will remember this. Every single one of you.

INT. PRISON CELL - NIGHT (THREE YEARS LATER)

SONG YUAN sits on a thin mattress, her face hardened, eyes sharp. She holds a worn photograph—the only image she has: an ultrasound.

SONG YUAN
(internal monologue)
Three years. Three years to plan. They took everything from me—my child, my freedom, my name.

She traces the ultrasound image with her finger.

SONG YUAN (CONT'D)
(internal monologue)
But I survived. And when I walk out of here, they'll learn what it means to cross Song Yuan.

A GUARD approaches the cell.

GUARD
Song Yuan. Release papers came through. You're out tomorrow.

SONG YUAN looks up slowly, a cold smile forming.

SONG YUAN
(quietly)
Finally.

FADE TO BLACK.

INT. PRISON ENTRANCE - DAY

Heavy gates slide open. SONG YUAN steps out, wearing simple clothes, carrying a small bag. The sunlight hits her face.

She takes a deep breath.

SONG YUAN
(to herself)
The Song family thinks I'm dead and buried. Time to show them ghosts are real.

A black car waits across the street. The window rolls down, revealing a MYSTERIOUS WOMAN in sunglasses.

MYSTERIOUS WOMAN
Song Yuan?

SONG YUAN
(cautious)
Who's asking?

MYSTERIOUS WOMAN
Someone who knows what really happened to your baby.

SONG YUAN freezes. Her composure cracks for just a moment.

MYSTERIOUS WOMAN (CONT'D)
Get in. We have much to discuss.

SONG YUAN hesitates, then walks toward the car with renewed purpose.

FADE OUT.

END OF EPISODE 1
all_cases.continuation_excerpt:
INT. BEDROOM - LATER

SONG YUAN lies exhausted, sweat-soaked, reaching weakly toward the door.

SONG YUAN
(desperate)
My baby... let me see my baby...

MRS. SONG returns, her face cold as stone. She carries nothing in her arms.

MRS. SONG
It's done. The child is gone.

SONG YUAN
(screaming)
No! Where is my baby?! What did you do?!

She tries to rise but collapses, too weak from the birth.

SONG XIYUE
(feigning sympathy)
Sister, it's better this way. Think of the family's reputation.

SONG YUAN
(sobbing)
You monsters... you killed my child...

MRS. SONG
(coldly)
We saved this family from your shame. Now rest. You have another duty to perform.

INT. SONG FAMILY LIVING ROOM - THREE DAYS LATER

SONG YUAN, pale and barely able to stand, is dragged downstairs by two SERVANTS. POLICE OFFICERS wai...

all_cases.context:
Title: Reborn to Stop Pleasing
Description: A girl dies after being framed by her adopted sister and mistreated by her family. She is reborn five years earlier and vows never to seek their approval again.

INT. LUXURY VILLA / STAIRCASE - DAY

Marble staircase gleams under crystal chandeliers. SONG YUWEI (16, school uniform, ponytail) clutches a perfect test paper, ascending carefully. SONG JIAOJIAO (17, black sequined dress) descends, a jade bracelet visible in her clutch.

They collide at the landing. The bracelet tumbles out, clattering on marble.

SONG YUWEI
(startled)
Mom's jade—

SONG JIAOJIAO
(coldly)
You saw nothing.

SONG YUWEI
(bending to retrieve it)
That's Mom's anniversary gift. She thought she lost it.

JIAOJIAO snatches it first, but YUWEI grabs her wrist.

SONG JIAOJIAO
(low, dangerous)
Let. Go.

She shoves. YUWEI stumbles backward, tumbling down the stairs. Her head cracks against the banister. Blood pools beneath her.

JIAOJIAO rushes down, crouching to watch YUWEI struggle.

SONG YUWEI
(gasping)
Please... Mom will know...
YUWEI's hand grasps JIAOJIAO's ankle.

SONG JIAOJIAO
(hissing)
You're staining my dress.

She shakes YUWEI off. The bracelet falls, shattering. JIAOJIAO's eyes narrow. She snatches a crystal figurine from a side table.

SONG JIAOJIAO
(whispering)
You've always broken everything you touch.

She strikes YUWEI's temple. YUWEI goes limp.

JIAOJIAO presses a shard of jade to her own forehead, slicing skin just as—

all_cases.continuation:
INT. LUXURY VILLA / STAIRCASE - CONTINUOUS

MRS. SONG (40s, silk qipao) freezes at the base of the stairs, her face draining of color.

MRS. SONG
(screaming)
Yuwei! Jiaojiao! What happened?!

JIAOJIAO immediately collapses into sobs, clutching her bleeding forehead.

SONG JIAOJIAO
(weeping)
Mother... I tried to stop her... She found out I borrowed your bracelet and just... snapped...

She holds up the shattered jade pieces, her hands trembling theatrically.

SONG JIAOJIAO (CONT'D)
She attacked me with it... When I pushed her away... she fell...

Mrs. Song rushes to Jiaojiao, cradling her "injured" daughter, ignoring Yuwei's crumpled form.

MRS. SONG
(to the household staff, shouting)
Call an ambulance! Now!

MR. SONG (50s, tailored suit) appears at the doorway, briefcase dropping with a thud.

MR. SONG
What's all this—

His gaze lands on Yuwei's still body. Blood seeps across the marble like an accusation.

MR. SONG (CONT'D)
(icy)
She's always been clumsy.

Yuwei's vision blurs. The chandelier above fractures into a thousand points of light.

SONG YUWEI
(V.O., faint)
So this is how it ends... pleasing them until I die...

Her breathing slows. The voices fade to a distant hum.

FADE TO WHITE:

INT. SONG FAMILY VILLA / YUWEI'S BEDROOM - DAY (FIVE YEARS EARLIER)

Sunlight streams through pink curtains. Eleven-year-old Yuwei sits at a small desk, crayons scattered. A half-drawn picture of a family—stick figures with smiling faces.

She blinks. Once. Twice. Her small hands flex.

SONG YUWEI
(internal monologue)
The crayons... the wallpaper... this was...

Her eyes widen, landing on a calendar: 2019.

SONG YUWEI (CONT'D)
(whisper)
Five years... before I died.

Downstairs, she hears Mrs. Song's voice—gentle, calling.

MRS. SONG (O.S.)
Yuwei, sweetheart! Jiaojiao's adoption papers came through! Come meet your new sister!

Yuwei's grip tightens on the crayon. It snaps.

SONG YUWEI
(quietly, with five years of venom)
Not this time.

She stands, crosses to the mirror. Her reflection stares back—innocent face, ancient eyes.

SONG YUWEI (CONT'D)
I won't please you. Any of you.

She opens her bedroom door. The hallway stretches before her, familiar and treacherous. She steps forward, each footfall deliberate.

SONG YUWEI (CONT'D)
(V.O.)
Let the game begin. And this time, I know all the rules.

Title: Escape from the Pillow
Description: A woman betrayed by her husband and cousin is given a second chance when she wakes up three minutes before the tragedy that killed her.

INT. HOSPITAL CORRIDOR - NIGHT

FAST CUTS: Headlights slice through torrential rain. An ambulance screeches to a halt. Medical staff rush two hospital beds down the corridor. JIANG RANRAN and SHEN YIYI lie on the beds, moaning. Blood covers Ranran's legs.

ZHOU YIXUAN
(anxiously)
Stay with me, Ranran.

JIANG JINGYU
Hold on, Ranran.

JIANG JINGYU
(to Zhou Yixuan)
The merger needs me. You'll stay?

JIANG RANRAN
(weakly)
Go. He'll be here.

JIANG JINGYU
(to Zhou Yixuan)
Protect her.

Jiang Jingyu exits. Zhou Yixuan pushes the bed into the operating room with staff.

INT. OPERATING ROOM - DAY

Zhou Yixuan waits outside. Inside, doctors work. Ranran's monitor alarms.

The Doctor meets Zhou Yixuan's eyes through the glass, holds up three fingers.

DOCTOR
(muffled through glass)
Mother or child?

ZHOU YIXUAN
(intercom button)
There must be another way.

DOCTOR
Not full term. Fall caused malpositioning. Decide.

Zhou Yixuan's knuckles whiten. His reflection smiles.

ZHOU YIXUAN
Save the baby. She'd want her daughter.

Ranran screams.

all_cases.continuation:
INT. OPERATING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

Ranran's hand grips the surgical table. Her eyes flutter open, unfocused.

JIANG RANRAN
(weakly, to herself)
Three minutes...

The doctors continue working. Monitors beep frantically.

DOCTOR
She's losing too much blood.

Zhou Yixuan stares through the glass, his reflection wavering in the distortion.

ZHOU YIXUAN
(to the glass)
Ranran, fight.

Ranran's eyes find his through the glass. A strange clarity enters them.

JIANG RANRAN
(whispered, but audible)
The merger... the documents... check the safe.

Zhou Yixuan's expression changes. Confusion, then concern.

ZHOU YIXUAN
What safe?

JIANG RANRAN
(increasingly weak)
Home office... red book... three minutes...

Her eyes close. The monitor flatlines.

DOCTOR
Time of death: 11:47 PM.

INT. JIANG RANRAN'S BEDROOM - NIGHT

Ranran's eyes SNAP open. She sits up gasping, checking her phone: 11:44 PM.

JIANG RANRAN
(breathless)
Three minutes.

She looks around her bedroom - normal, undamaged. No hospital. No blood.

Her phone buzzes. Text from Zhou Yixuan: "Pick you up at midnight for dinner with Jingyu."

Ranran stares at the message, then at her reflection in the mirror. Uninjured. Alive.

JIANG RANRAN
(to her reflection)
It happened. But now...

She grabs her phone, dials frantically.

JIANG RANRAN
(into phone)
Yixuan? Don't come. Something's wrong.

INTERCUT - PHONE CONVERSATION

ZHOU YIXUAN (V.O.)
What do you mean? We had plans—

JIANG RANRAN
Trust me. Call Jingyu. Tell him to check the office safe.

ZHOU YIXUAN (V.O.)
Ranran, you're scaring me. What office safe?

Ranran looks at her phone: 11:45 PM.

JIANG RANRAN
The red book with the merger documents. Red book.

ZHOU YIXUAN (V.O.)
How do you know about—

The line goes dead. Ranran stares at her phone, then at the clock: 11:46 PM.

JIANG RANRAN
(whispered)
One minute.

all_cases.context:
Title: New Year's Eve
Description: A desperate worker confronts his corrupt boss on a rooftop after being denied wages needed for his dying mother's surgery.

INT. ROOFTOP - NIGHT

Brilliant fireworks bloom in the night sky, snowflakes falling.

ZHANG WEI, face bruised, clutches his mother's black-and-white portrait, standing at the edge of the rooftop.

A group of COWORKERS watch him anxiously from a distance.

ZHANG WEI
(roaring)
Wang Kun! Get Wang Kun up here!

A COWORKER takes a careful step forward, holding a thermos.

COWORKER
Brother Zhang... it's New Year's. We brought dumplings. Still warm.

ZHANG WEI
Stay back! I'll jump!

COWORKER
He's coming! Just hold on!

Boss WANG KUN arrives with foreman MA KAI and LI JUAN.

WANG KUN
(contemptuously)
Zhang Wei. Come down. We can negotiate.

ZHANG WEI
(pointing at Wang Kun)
Kowtow to my mother! Confess what you did!

WANG KUN
(laughing)
Confess? Your mother died of illness. Tragic, but not my concern.

ZHANG WEI
(voice breaking with tears)
You withheld my wages! Her surgery was tomorrow! You knew!

MA KAI
(stepping forward)
Spoilage penalties. It's in the handbook you signed. Legal and documented.

ZHANG WEI
(furious)
Legal? You changed the rules!

LI JUAN
(quietly)
Zhang Wei... please. Don't make this worse. For both of us.

ZHANG WEI
(turning to Li Juan, sudden realization)
You. You're wearing his watch.

LI JUAN
(defensive)
I made a choice! Someone had to be realistic!

WANG KUN
(to Zhang Wei)
You're a contractor, not family. We have procedures. Your mother—unfortunate timing.

ZHANG WEI
(despairingly)
Timing...

He looks at the portrait, then at the fireworks.

WANG KUN
I can offer 10,000. For funeral expenses. Sign the release, it's yours.

ZHANG WEI
Ten thousand. For her life.

WANG KUN
Business is business. Sign, or get nothing.

ZHANG WEI becomes agitated, his foot slips on the icy edge, and he falls from the rooftop. He crashes heavily into the snow below, blood flowing from his mouth and nose, the portrait frame shattered.

WANG KUN runs to the edge of the rooftop, looks down, then turns to face the crowd.

WANG KUN
(calmly)
You all saw. He lost his footing. Tragic accident.
(to Ma Kai)
Call Chief Liu. Get the settlement papers ready.

WANG KUN starts toward the stairs.

WANG KUN
(to Li Juan)
Come on. There's a banquet waiting.

He leaves. The fireworks continue, reflected in Li Juan's tears.

TRANSITION: Several hours earlier
all_cases.context_excerpt:
Title: New Year's Eve
Description: A desperate worker confronts his corrupt boss on a rooftop after being denied wages needed for his dying mother's surgery.

INT. ROOFTOP - NIGHT

Brilliant fireworks bloom in the night sky, snowflakes falling.

ZHANG WEI, face bruised, clutches his mother's black-and-white portrait, standing at the edge of the rooftop.

ZHANG WEI
(roaring)
Wang Kun! Get Wang Kun up here!

A COWORKER takes a careful step...
all_cases.continuation:
INT. FACTORY BREAK ROOM - DAY

Fluorescent lights flicker overhead. The hum of machinery vibrates through the walls.

ZHANG WEI sits at a chipped plastic table, counting crumpled bills. He wears a threadbare coat, his breath visible in the unheated room. A hospital invoice lies beside him—STAMPED: "SURGERY SCHEDULED: DEC 31."

He dials a number on a cracked phone.

ZHANG WEI  
(softly)  
Ma… I got it. Almost all of it. Just need the last payment from Wang Kun today.  

(PAUSE. His eyes well up.)  

You rest easy. Tomorrow, you’ll be better. I promise.  

He hangs up, tucks the photo of his mother into his breast pocket, and stands.

CUT TO:

EXT. FACTORY OFFICE - LATER

ZHANG WEI approaches WANG KUN’s glass-walled office. Through the window, he sees WANG KUN laughing with LI JUAN over steaming tea. She wears a new coat—expensive, red wool.

ZHANG WEI knocks.

WANG KUN doesn’t look up.

WANG KUN  
Contractors don’t get bonuses, Zhang Wei. You know that.  

ZHANG WEI  
It’s not a bonus. It’s my wages. For November and December.  

WANG KUN  
(sighs, finally turning)  
There were damages. The shipment to Guangzhou? Half the tiles cracked. You signed the liability clause.  

ZHANG WEI  
That was the loader’s fault! Ma Kai overloaded the pallet—  

MA KAI appears in the doorway behind him, arms crossed.  

MA KAI  
Your signature’s on the log. Not mine.  

LI JUAN avoids Zhang Wei’s gaze, sipping her tea.

ZHANG WEI  
(stunned)  
Li Juan… you were there. You saw—  

LI JUAN  
(flatly)  
I saw you take the job knowing the risks. We all do what we have to.  

ZHANG WEI stares at her. A beat. Then he pulls out the hospital invoice, places it on Wang Kun’s desk.

ZHANG WEI  
My mother’s surgery is tomorrow. If I don’t pay by midnight, they cancel.  

WANG KUN  
(slides the paper back)  
Not my problem. Come back when you’ve read your contract.  

ZHANG WEI  
Please. Just half. I’ll sign anything.  

WANG KUN  
(leaning forward, cold)  
You want money? Grovel. On your knees. Like your kind should.  

Silence. The factory noise fades into a dull roar.

ZHANG WEI doesn’t move. Doesn’t kneel.

WANG KUN smirks, picks up the invoice, and tears it slowly in half.

WANG KUN  
Happy New Year.  

ZHANG WEI turns and walks out, fists clenched, snow beginning to fall outside.

FADE TO BLACK.

all_cases.context:
Title: Supreme Prince Consort
Description: A modern bioengineer dies from experimental serum overload and awakens in the body of a prince targeted for castration—his own research may be the key to survival.

INT. PRINCE OF ZHENBEI'S MANOR - NIGHT

Dark clouds veil the full moon, casting shadows across orange lanterns swaying beneath the eaves.

QIN FEIYANG lies rigid on a rosewood bed, silk sheets tangled at his waist. His eyes move frantically beneath closed lids.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(intellectual panic)
Song dynasty dagger pattern. I've studied enough metallurgy to know this isn't a normal dream—

ASSASSIN A checks Qin Feiyang's pulse.

ASSASSIN A
The meng-hun powder should hold three hours. Young Master wants him conscious for the procedure.

ASSASSIN B produces a curved dagger.

ASSASSIN B
Five hundred taels for a surgical cut. Don't disappoint the client.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(sudden clarity)
Procedure? Client? That's not historical accuracy—

QIN FEIYANG's eyes snap open. He registers the blade.

QIN FEIYANG
(disoriented cadence)
This body—it's been drugged!

He rolls sideways, silk robe twisting around him, and crashes to the floor.

QIN FEIYANG
(panicked authority)
Treason! Guards! Anyone with a sword!

The assassins freeze—this wasn't the mission profile.

A shadow detaches from the rafters. ZHENG FENG lands silently, sword already in motion.

ZHENG FENG
(cold)
You're not the only ones on retainer.

He fights with clinical precision—disarming, disabling. In five moves, both assassins kneel with broken wrists.

ZHENG FENG
(not turning)
Your late mother hired me. I'm the monthly expense you never questioned.

QIN FEIYANG clutches the bedpost as his vision splits: ancient tapestry overlaid with lab safety posters.

CUT TO:
all_cases.context_excerpt:
Title: Supreme Prince Consort
Description: A modern bioengineer dies from experimental serum overload and awakens in the body of a prince targeted for castration—his own research may be the key to survival.

INT. PRINCE OF ZHENBEI'S MANOR - NIGHT

Dark clouds veil the full moon, casting shadows across orange lanterns swaying beneath the eaves.

QIN FEIYANG lies rigid on a rosewood bed, silk sheets tangled at his waist. His eyes move frantically beneath closed lids.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(intellect...
all_cases.continuation:
QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(analytical)
Dual visual cortex input. Either severe neurological trauma or—

He presses fingers to his carotid artery, counting.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
Pulse 140. Adrenaline response consistent with genuine threat perception. This isn't hallucination.

ZHENG FENG binds the assassins with silk cord, movements economical.

ZHENG FENG
The household guards were drugged. Kitchen staff. Your personal attendants. Whoever arranged this has access.

QIN FEIYANG
(processing)
Young Master. They mentioned a Young Master.

ZHENG FENG
(flat)
Your elder brother controls the eastern trade routes. Your younger brother has the Empress Dowager's favor. You have—

He gestures at the sparse room.

ZHENG FENG (CONT'D)
A title and enemies.

QIN FEIYANG staggers to a bronze mirror. The face staring back shares his bone structure but carries different scars—a childhood burn across the jaw, calluses from horseback riding.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(scientific observation)
Same genetic template. Different environmental expression. I'm not possessing a stranger—I'm occupying a parallel iteration.

He examines his hands. Soft. Uncalloused. This body hasn't worked in years.

QIN FEIYANG
(to himself)
The serum. Compound 7-Alpha. It was designed to repair cellular degradation through quantum biological resonance—

ZHENG FENG
(sharp)
You're speaking gibberish.

QIN FEIYANG
(catching himself)
The drugs. Affecting my speech.

He forces his breathing to slow.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
The procedure they mentioned. What were they planning to remove?

ZHENG FENG's expression doesn't change, but his silence speaks.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(grim realization)
Castration. They were going to make me a eunuch.

He laughs—a sound with no humor in it.

QIN FEIYANG
Someone wants me removed from succession permanently without the political cost of murder.

ZHENG FENG
You've never shown this much clarity before.

QIN FEIYANG
(careful)
Near-death experiences sharpen the mind.

He moves to the assassins, crouching despite his trembling legs.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
Five hundred taels. That's significant but not extravagant. A noble's budget, not imperial. The client wanted deniability.

ASSASSIN A spits blood.

ASSASSIN A
Kill us. We won't talk.

QIN FEIYANG
(clinical)
You've already talked. The powder you used—meng-hun—requires specific preparation. Three apothecaries in the capital stock the base ingredients. Your accent places you from Jiangnan. You traveled at least eight days for this contract.

He stands.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
Someone planned this for weeks. Someone patient.

ZHENG FENG
(reassessing)
The original Qin Feiyang couldn't deduce his way out of a poetry exam.

QIN FEIYANG
(quiet)
The original Qin Feiyang died tonight.

A beat. Zheng Feng's hand moves to his sword hilt.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(quickly)
Metaphorically. The man who let enemies drug his household, who ignored monthly expenses, who didn't question why he was still alive—

He meets Zheng Feng's eyes.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
That man is gone. I intend to survive.

ZHENG FENG
Your mother said the same thing. She lasted three years after your father's death.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(noting)
Murdered. The implication is clear.

QIN FEIYANG
Then I'll need to be smarter than she was.

He crosses to a writing desk, rifling through documents. His hands shake—the drug still metabolizing.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
Household accounts. Correspondence. I need to understand my position.

ZHENG FENG
You're the Prince of Zhenbei. Third in line for nothing. Your territory generates minimal revenue. Your military allocation was cut last spring.

QIN FEIYANG
(reading)
And I'm betrothed.

He holds up a scroll bearing an imperial seal.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
To the daughter of Grand Secretary Wei. Marriage scheduled for—

His face pales.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
Twelve days.

ZHENG FENG
The castration would have voided the contract. Scandal for your family, not the Weis.

QIN FEIYANG
(understanding)
Someone doesn't want this marriage to happen. Someone with more to lose than five hundred taels.

He sets down the scroll.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(to himself)
Compound 7-Alpha was designed to enhance cellular regeneration. If the transfer preserved my neural patterns, it may have preserved the serum's base modifications.

He pinches his forearm, drawing blood with his nail. Watches it bead.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(observing)
Clotting time accelerated. Interesting.

ZHENG FENG
What are you doing?

QIN FEIYANG
Testing a theory.

He wraps a cloth around the small wound.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
I need a physician. Someone discreet. Someone who won't report to whoever poisoned my guards.

ZHENG FENG
There's a woman in the outer city. Treats injuries without questions.

QIN FEIYANG
Perfect.

He moves toward the door, then stops.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
The assassins. Don't kill them yet. They're leverage.

ZHENG FENG
(skeptical)
You want to negotiate with people who tried to unman you?

QIN FEIYANG
(cold smile)
I want to understand the market rate for my destruction. It tells me exactly how much I'm worth to my enemies.

He steps into the corridor. Moonlight breaks through the clouds, illuminating his face—same features, different eyes.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(determined)
Twelve days until marriage. Unknown enemies. A body I don't fully understand. And somewhere in my cellular structure, the remnants of a serum that killed me once.

He looks at his hands again.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Time to run some experiments.

CUT TO:

INT. OUTER CITY - APOTHECARY - LATER

A cramped shop filled with dried herbs and animal bones. DOCTOR SONG, 50s, weathered face and sharp eyes, examines Qin Feiyang's pupils by candlelight.

DOCTOR SONG
Meng-hun powder. Expensive taste for common assassins.

QIN FEIYANG
How long until full clearance?

DOCTOR SONG
(surprised)
You know pharmacological terminology?

QIN FEIYANG
(covering)
I read.

DOCTOR SONG
Most princes don't.

She checks his pulse at three points—wrist, neck, temple.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
Your qi circulation is abnormal. Too fast. Like your body is running a fever without the heat.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(analyzing)
Elevated metabolism. The serum's regenerative properties requiring increased energy expenditure.

QIN FEIYANG
Is it dangerous?

DOCTOR SONG
Unknown. I've never seen this pattern before.

She releases his wrist.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
You should be unconscious. The dosage they used would fell an ox. Yet here you are, asking questions with perfect clarity.

QIN FEIYANG
I've always been resilient.

DOCTOR SONG
(dry)
Your reputation suggests otherwise.

She moves to her shelves, selecting herbs.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
Rumors say you're a wastrel. Gambling debts. Wine. Women of negotiable virtue. The kind of prince who embarrasses his bloodline.

QIN FEIYANG
Rumors are often cultivated.

DOCTOR SONG pauses.

DOCTOR SONG
By whom?

QIN FEIYANG
(realizing)
I don't know yet. But someone wanted me seen as worthless. Unworthy of protection. Easy to remove.

He stands, testing his balance. Steadier now.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
I need information about my betrothed. Wei family. Grand Secretary's daughter.

DOCTOR SONG
WEI QINGYAN. Twenty-two. Educated beyond her station. Refused three previous matches.

QIN FEIYANG
Why?

DOCTOR SONG
(mixing herbs)
She found them intellectually insufficient.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(intrigued)
A woman who values intelligence in this era. Unusual.

QIN FEIYANG
And she accepted me?

DOCTOR SONG
The Emperor commanded it. Even brilliant women can't refuse imperial decrees.

She hands him a packet of herbs.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
Brew this twice daily. It won't cure whatever's happening inside you, but it will mask the symptoms.

QIN FEIYANG
You're helping me without knowing my intentions.

DOCTOR SONG
Your mother saved my daughter from a trafficking ring. I owed her a debt.

She meets his eyes.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
You don't remember, do you? You were twelve. You cried when you saw the conditions those girls lived in.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(processing)
This body's memories. Fragmented. Emotional residue without narrative context.

QIN FEIYANG
(carefully)
I remember the feeling. Not the details.

DOCTOR SONG
That's what trauma does.

She opens the door.

DOCTOR SONG (CONT'D)
Your mother was murdered, Prince Qin. Everyone knows it. No one can prove it.

QIN FEIYANG
(quiet)
I intend to change that.

He steps into the night.

CUT TO:

EXT. CAPITAL STREETS - CONTINUOUS

Qin Feiyang walks through shadowed alleys, Zheng Feng a silent presence behind him.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(cataloging)
Facts: Someone wants me dead or worse. My mother was killed. My betrothed is intelligent. My body contains unknown modifications from experimental serum exposure.

He pauses at a bridge overlooking a canal.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Variables: Which brother ordered the castration? What does the Wei family gain from this marriage? Why did the Emperor command it?

ZHENG FENG
(low)
We're being followed.

QIN FEIYANG
(not turning)
How many?

ZHENG FENG
Three. Professional distance. They're not attacking—observing.

QIN FEIYANG
Then let them observe.

He leans on the bridge railing.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(louder, deliberate)
The Prince of Zhenbei survives assassination. Walks openly through the capital. Shows no fear.

ZHENG FENG
You're baiting them.

QIN FEIYANG
I'm sending a message. The worthless prince died tonight. Someone new is wearing his face.

He turns and walks toward his manor.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(to Zheng Feng)
Tomorrow I meet my betrothed. I need to understand what kind of alliance this marriage represents.

ZHENG FENG
The Weis are reformists. They want to restructure the examination system. Your family is traditional. The marriage makes no political sense.

QIN FEIYANG
(thoughtful)
Unless it's not about politics. Unless it's about something else entirely.

They reach the manor gates. Guards—new ones—stand at attention.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(to Zheng Feng)
Double the watch. Screen everyone entering the kitchen. And find out which of my brothers has gambling debts.

ZHENG FENG
Both of them.

QIN FEIYANG
(grim smile)
Then find out which one owes money to people who'd accept five hundred taels for surgical services.

He enters the manor.

INT. PRINCE OF ZHENBEI'S MANOR - STUDY - NIGHT

Qin Feiyang sits surrounded by scrolls and ledgers. Candles burn low.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(reading)
Compound 7-Alpha was designed to repair telomere degradation. Theoretical immortality through cellular regeneration. The side effects were supposed to be minimal.

He flexes his hand, watching tendons move beneath skin.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Instead, it killed me. And somehow, impossibly, transferred my consciousness into a parallel version of myself.

He picks up a brush, begins writing.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
Hypothesis: The serum created a quantum biological bridge between iterations. My neural patterns survived physical death by anchoring to compatible genetic material across dimensional barriers.

He pauses.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
That's insane. But so is everything else happening right now.

A knock at the door.

QIN FEIYANG
Enter.

A SERVANT enters, bowing.

SERVANT
Your Highness. A message from the Wei household.

Qin Feiyang takes the scroll. Breaks the seal.

INSERT - SCROLL

Elegant calligraphy reads: "The stars align poorly for our meeting tomorrow. I suggest we postpone until the heavens are more favorable. - Wei Qingyan"

BACK TO SCENE

QIN FEIYANG
(reading between lines)
She's heard about the assassination attempt. She's testing my response.

He reaches for fresh paper.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(writing, speaking aloud)
"Lady Wei. The stars care nothing for human affairs. I have survived what was meant to destroy me. I would very much like to meet the woman intelligent enough to refuse three noble suitors. Tomorrow. Noon. The Pavilion of Reflected Clouds. - Qin Feiyang."

He seals the letter.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
(to servant)
Deliver this tonight.

SERVANT
Your Highness, the hour is—

QIN FEIYANG
(firm)
Tonight.

The servant bows and exits.

Qin Feiyang returns to his notes.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
In twelve days, I marry a stranger. In less time than that, someone will try to kill me again. The only advantages I have are a modified physiology I don't understand and knowledge from a world that doesn't exist here.

He sets down his brush.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.) (CONT'D)
It will have to be enough.

FADE TO:

INT. PAVILION OF REFLECTED CLOUDS - DAY

Sunlight filters through latticed screens. A pond reflects willow branches.

Qin Feiyang waits, dressed in simple robes—no jewelry, no ostentation.

ZHENG FENG
(from shadows)
She's late.

QIN FEIYANG
She's establishing control. It's a negotiation tactic.

Footsteps on wooden boards.

WEI QINGYAN enters. Late twenties, sharp features, eyes that miss nothing. She wears scholar's robes—unusual for a noblewoman.

WEI QINGYAN
(cool)
You're not what I expected.

QIN FEIYANG
(rising, bowing)
Neither are you.

WEI QINGYAN
I expected a wastrel. A man who would bore me within minutes.

QIN FEIYANG
And instead?

WEI QINGYAN
(studying him)
Instead I see someone who survived an assassination attempt and responded by demanding a meeting in a public space. Either brave or stupid.

QIN FEIYANG
Why not both?

A ghost of a smile crosses her face.

WEI QINGYAN
My father believes this marriage will protect our family. The Emperor commanded it, which means someone powerful wants it to happen.

QIN FEIYANG
And what do you believe?

WEI QINGYAN
(sitting)
I believe we're both pawns in a game we don't understand. The question is whether we'll be sacrificed or promoted.

QIN FEIYANG sits across from her.

QIN FEIYANG
You refused three suitors. Men with more power, more wealth, more prospects than me. Why?

WEI QINGYAN
They saw me as decoration. A educated wife to display at functions.

QIN FEIYANG
And you want more.

WEI QINGYAN
(direct)
I want a partner. Someone who values intelligence over submission. The rumors said you were incapable of such partnership.

QIN FEIYANG
The rumors were cultivated.

WEI QINGYAN
(sharp)
By whom?

QIN FEIYANG
I'm still determining that.

She leans forward.

WEI QINGYAN
Last night, someone tried to castrate you. Today, you sit here discussing politics with perfect composure. What changed?

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(deciding)
She's too intelligent for simple lies. Partial truth, then.

QIN FEIYANG
I died last night. The man who woke up isn't the same person who fell asleep.

WEI QINGYAN
(skeptical)
Poetic.

QIN FEIYANG
Literal.

Their eyes meet. Something passes between them—recognition of equals.

WEI QINGYAN
My father has enemies. Your family has enemies. This marriage combines those enemies into a single target.

QIN FEIYANG
Or combines our resources into a single defense.

WEI QINGYAN
(testing)
What resources do you offer? A diminished title? Empty coffers? A reputation for failure?

QIN FEIYANG
(quiet)
Knowledge. The kind that doesn't exist in any library.

WEI QINGYAN
(intrigued despite herself)
What kind of knowledge?

QIN FEIYANG
The kind that could change everything.

He pulls a paper from his sleeve—a diagram of molecular structures, drawn from memory.

QIN FEIYANG (CONT'D)
Tell me, Lady Wei. Have you ever considered that illness might be caused by creatures too small to see?

Wei Qingyan takes the paper. Studies it.

WEI QINGYAN
(slowly)
This notation. I've never seen anything like it.

QIN FEIYANG
No one has. Not here.

She looks up at him—really looks.

WEI QINGYAN
Who are you?

QIN FEIYANG
(honest)
I'm still figuring that out.

A long pause.

WEI QINGYAN
(deciding)
The marriage proceeds. But I have conditions.

QIN FEIYANG
Name them.

WEI QINGYAN
Full partnership. No secrets. And you teach me whatever this is.

She holds up the diagram.

QIN FEIYANG
(extending his hand)
Agreed.

She takes it. Her grip is firm.

WEI QINGYAN
(quiet)
Whoever tried to destroy you made a mistake. They created something new.

QIN FEIYANG
(grim)
Let's make sure they regret it.

FADE OUT.
all_cases.continuation_excerpt:
QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
(analytical)
Dual visual cortex input. Either severe neurological trauma or—

He presses fingers to his carotid artery, counting.

QIN FEIYANG (V.O.)
Pulse 140. Adrenaline response consistent with genuine threat perception. This isn't hallucination.

ZHENG FENG binds the assassins with silk cord, movements economical.

ZHENG FENG
The household guards were drugged. Kitchen staff. Your personal attendants. Whoever arranged this has access.

QIN FEIYANG
(processing)
Young Master. They mentioned a Young Master.

ZHENG FENG
(flat)
Your elder brother controls the eastern trade routes. Your younger brother has the Empress Dowager's favor. You have—

He gestures at the sparse room.

ZHENG FENG (CONT'D)
A title and enemies.

QIN FEIYANG staggers to a bronze mirror. The face stari...

Title: Dragon Lord of the Nation
Description: A security guard who moonlights as a ride-share driver hides his true identity as the legendary Dragon Lord, protector of the Great Xia nation.

EXT. OFFICE BUILDING - DAY

SECURITY GUARD A stifles a yawn, exhausted.

SECURITY GUARD B walks over, phone ready.

SECURITY GUARD A
Qin Feng. Ten-hour shifts, then ride-share till dawn. The kid's a machine.

SECURITY GUARD B
For a wife like his? I'd work three jobs. But watch this.

SECURITY GUARD B takes out his phone, and the two huddle together to watch.

INT. PHONE SCREEN - NIGHT

Shaky footage shows QIN FENG in scarred armor fighting NINJAS. Lightning crackles. Overlaid text: "DRAGON LORD HOAX?" Comments scroll: "FAKE."

THUNDER GOD RAY (V.O.)
Your reign ends tonight.

QIN FENG (V.O.)
Great Xia stands.

The screen whites out in a massive explosion.

all_cases.continuation:
INT. SECURITY OFFICE - CONTINUOUS

The two guards stare at the black screen, disappointed.

SECURITY GUARD B
See? Total fake. Guy probably just some CGI artist with too much time on his hands.

SECURITY GUARD A
Still... look at those production values. Someone's making bank off this Dragon Lord nonsense.

SECURITY GUARD B
Hey, check this out.

He scrolls through more comments on his phone.

SECURITY GUARD B (CONT'D)
"Dragon Lord is the only thing keeping the bad guys away." "My neighborhood's been safe since he appeared." 

SECURITY GUARD A
People are desperate for heroes, I guess.

A CRASH echoes from outside. Both guards jump.

SECURITY GUARD B
What was that?

They rush to the window.

EXT. CITY STREET - CONTINUOUS

Smoke rises from an overturned car. A figure in dark armor stands in the middle of the road, lightning crackling around his fists.

THUNDER GOD RAY
(into phone)
Target acquired. The Dragon Lord will surface.

He looks directly up at the security office window.

THUNDER GOD RAY (CONT'D)
I know you're watching.

INT. SECURITY OFFICE - CONTINUOUS

SECURITY GUARD A
(whispering)
That's... that's the same voice from the video.

SECURITY GUARD B
No way. It's just some cosplayer. Has to be.

But his voice wavers with uncertainty.

Another CRASH. The lights flicker.

QIN FENG (O.S.)
(muffled, from down the hall)
Everything okay up there?

They turn to see Qin Feng approaching, still in his security uniform, coffee cup in hand.

SECURITY GUARD A
(forced casual)
Yeah, just... checking the news.

Qin Feng walks to the window, peers down at the scene below. His expression darkens.

QIN FENG
(quietly)
That's not a cosplayer.

SECURITY GUARD B
What do you mean?

Qin Feng's eyes begin to glow with a faint golden light.

QIN FENG
I mean we have about thirty seconds before he levels this building.

He sets down his coffee cup. It shatters on impact.

QIN FENG (CONT'D)
You might want to call in sick tomorrow.

all_cases.context:
Title: Flying Life: 1988
Description: A father sells his daughter for money, leading to tragedy and a cycle of revenge that spans twenty years.

INT. QI FENG'S HOUSE - NIGHT

A man (THIRD BROTHER) examines a little girl's (QI XIAOYA) teeth.

QI XIAOYA
(crying)
Dad, I'm scared.

QI FENG
(to Xiaoya)
Quiet.
(to Third Brother)
She's healthy. Never sick.

THIRD BROTHER
Six hundred. Market's flooded.

QI FENG
You said eight last month!

THIRD BROTHER
Take it or leave it. The loan sharks want their money tonight.

Qi Feng glances at the table: medical bills, pill bottles, a loan notice.

QI FENG grabs Xiaoya's arm, hard.

QI XIAOYA
Dad, I'll eat less! I promise!

QI FENG hands XIAOYA to THIRD BROTHER, who passes him a thin stack of cash. QI FENG counts it frantically.

THIRD BROTHER and his accomplice carry away the struggling XIAOYA.

SU QIAN enters, dropping groceries, seeing the scene.

SU QIAN
Qi Feng! What are you doing?

QI FENG
Stay out of it!

They struggle. He pushes. She falls, hits her head, lies still.

QI XIAOYA
Mom!

The door slams. QI FENG drops beside SU QIAN. She stirs, eyes slits.

SU QIAN
(whisper)
My baby...

She crawls to the kitchen drawer. Pulls out scissors.

QI FENG
Su Qian, don't—

She stabs her stomach. Determined. Not theatrical. Blood spreads.

QI FENG catches her falling body.

SU QIAN
(blood on lips, barely breathing)
She will hate you... forever...

She goes limp. The money falls from QI FENG's hands, scattering.

all_cases.continuation:
INT. QI FENG'S HOUSE - NIGHT (CONTINUOUS)

Rain begins to patter on the roof. The room is silent except for Qi Feng’s ragged breathing.

He stares at Su Qian’s lifeless body in his arms. Blood soaks through his shirt. His hands tremble—not from fear, but from something deeper: realization, too late.

He gently lowers her to the floor. Stares at the scattered bills. One flutters near Xiaoya’s abandoned shoe.

A low, guttural sob escapes him. He doesn’t cry—just rocks slightly, eyes hollow.

Suddenly—sirens. Distant, then closer.

Qi Feng snaps alert. He scrambles up, wipes blood on his pants, scans the room like a cornered animal.

He grabs the cash, shoves it into his coat. Hesitates at Su Qian’s body. Reaches out... pulls the scissors from her stomach with a wet gasp.

He wraps them in a cloth from the counter. Tucks them inside his shirt—next to his heart.

The sirens wail outside. Headlights slice through the rain-streaked window.

Qi Feng bolts out the back door just as police cars skid to a stop in front.

EXT. ALLEY BEHIND HOUSE - NIGHT

Qi Feng runs through the downpour, slipping on wet cobblestones. He doesn’t look back.

But we do.

Through the rain-blurred kitchen window: Su Qian’s hand, pale and still, lies inches from a photo on the floor—Xiaoya’s school portrait, smiling.

DISSOLVE TO:

EXT. RAILROAD TRACKS - DAWN - 20 YEARS LATER

A woman (QI XIAOYA, now 27) stands alone on the tracks, suitcase at her feet. She wears a long coat, eyes sharp, unreadable. In her hand: a faded childhood photo—the same one from the kitchen floor.

A train whistle echoes in the distance.

She lights a cigarette. Exhales slowly.

QI XIAOYA  
(V.O., calm)  
You sold me for six hundred yuan.  
Now I’ve come back to collect interest.

She steps off the tracks as the train barrels past, shaking the earth.

FADE TO BLACK.

Title: Rose's Marriage
Description: A pregnant woman endures abuse from her mother-in-law and neglect from her husband, while suspecting his infidelity.

INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT

HUANG MEIGUI, 34, haggard-looking but with a tight-set jaw, struggles to stir congee one-handed while bracing her swollen belly. Sweat beads her forehead. Each small movement costs her.

INT. LIVING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

MOTHER-IN-LAW (70s, iron-gray perm) and granddaughter JINGJING (10) sit on the sofa watching TV. MOTHER-IN-LAW cracks sunflower seeds, her laugh a sharp bark.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
(laughing)
Ha ha ha.

XU RENJUN, 36, comes home from work, shoulders slumped. He places a premium formula tin on the coffee table.

XU RENJUN
I'm home.

MOTHER-IN-LAW's face immediately darkens. She squints at the imported brand.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
Son, these cans cost half your salary, don't they? Look at her belly—so round. Must be another girl who'll just spend my son's money. Ten years and she can't even give you a proper heir.

INT. DELIVERY ROOM - DAY (TEN YEARS AGO)

Flashback. YOUNG HUANG MEIGUI (24) lies on the delivery bed, screaming in agony.

HUANG MEIGUI
(screaming in pain)
Ah! Ah!

NURSE (V.O.)
The baby's in distress. We need to operate now!

DOCTOR (V.O.)
I need consent for a C-section. The mother can't hold on much longer.

MOTHER-IN-LAW (V.O.)
No anesthesia—it makes babies stupid. She's young. She can suffer for a grandson. My son needs an heir, even if she's... damaged.

HUANG MEIGUI hears this, her eyes snapping open in horror. Then closing in despair.

all_cases.continuation:
INT. KITCHEN - NIGHT (PRESENT)

Meigui’s eyes snap open, the phantom screams of the past fading into the hum of the refrigerator. She is back in the dim kitchen, her hand trembling on the ladle.

She takes a ragged breath, wiping the cold sweat from her brow.

MEIGUI
(whispering to her belly)
Not this time.

She grips the handles of the heavy pot, wincing as she lifts it.

INT. DINING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

Meigui sets the pot on the table with a heavy *thud*. The sound cuts through the TV noise.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
Look at that face. Long as a donkey's. You think you're the only woman in the world to have a baby?

Renjun sits at the table, loosening his tie. He doesn't look at Meigui. He places his phone face-down next to his bowl.

Meigui ladles congee into Renjun’s bowl. As she leans over him, she pauses. She sniffs. A faint, cloying scent of lilies—sickly sweet and distinct—wafts from his collar.

MEIGUI
You changed your cologne?

Renjun flinches, pulling away slightly.

XU RENJUN
What? No. It’s just... the air freshener in the office. They changed cleaning services.

He grabs his spoon, avoiding her gaze.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
Stop nagging him. The man works all day to pay for your expensive vitamins and that formula, and you greet him with an interrogation?

Meigui sits slowly, one hand supporting her aching back. She looks at Jingjing, who is quietly picking at her food, trying to make herself invisible.

MEIGUI
I just asked a question.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
(scoffing)
Look at this congee. Watery. No meat. You think a man can build strength on this? No wonder you’re so weak. If you carried a boy, maybe you’d have the energy to cook a proper meal.

XU RENJUN
Mom, it’s fine. Eat.

Renjun’s phone buzzes against the table. A long vibration. Then another.

Meigui’s eyes dart to the device. Renjun snatches it up instantly.

XU RENJUN
(standing up)
I have to take this. Work emergency.

He walks briskly to the balcony, sliding the glass door shut behind him. His voice is low, hushed, but his posture shifts—he leans against the railing, shoulders relaxing.

Meigui watches him through the glass. He isn't looking at his boss. He is smiling. It's a soft, eager smile she hasn't seen in years.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
(tapping her bowl with chopsticks)
Stop staring. Unless your eyes can cook a chicken, make yourself useful and get me some pickled vegetables.

Meigui doesn't move. Her gaze remains fixed on her husband’s reflection in the glass, and the faint smear of red—lipstick—on his white collar, visible now under the harsh balcony light.

MEIGUI
(internal monologue)
It’s not air freshener.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
Are you deaf? I said pickles!

Meigui turns to her mother-in-law. Her expression has shifted. The exhaustion is still there, but the fear is hardening into something colder.

MEIGUI
Get them yourself.

Silence falls over the table. Even the TV seems to quiet down. Jingjing stops chewing, eyes wide. Mother-in-law freezes, a sunflower seed shell falling from her lip.

MOTHER-IN-LAW
What did you say to me?
